original: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṁ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṁ dentā abbhentā.
analyzed: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsam dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattam dentā abbhentā
translated: And the monks, even though they are innocent, give him probation, send him back to the beginning, and give him the trial period.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ kareyya—
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, telling him,

original: nissāya te vatthabbanti.
analyzed: nissāya te vatthabbanti
translated: “You should stay with the monks, depending on them.”

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: “Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ seyyasako bhikkhu bālo abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: ayam seyyasakaḥ bhikkhu bālaḥ abyattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ anapadāno
translated: This monk Seyyasaka is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense.

original: gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi;
analyzed: gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: He associates inappropriately with householders.

original: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṁ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṁ dentā abbhentā.
analyzed: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsam dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattam dentā abbhentā
translated: And the monks, even though they are innocent, give him probation, send him back to the beginning, and give him the trial period.

original: Saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, telling him,

original: nissāya te vatthabbanti.
analyzed: nissāya te vatthabbanti
translated: “You should stay with the monks, depending on them.”

original: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa karaṇa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka should remain silent.

original: nissāya te vatthabbanti, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: nissāya te vatthabbanti saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: If you agree, remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.🔽Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya  dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: If you don’t, then speak up.🔽For the second time I speak on this matter.

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter.

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.🔽Ayaṁ seyyasako bhikkhu bālo abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ  ayam seyyasakaḥ bhikkhu bālaḥ abyattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ anapadāno
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi;
analyzed: gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: The monk Seyyasaka is ignorant and incompetent. He’s often committing offenses. He’s not living with the monks, but associating inappropriately with householders.

original: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṁ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṁ dentā abbhentā.
analyzed: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsam dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattam dentā abbhentā
translated: And the monks are giving him probation, sending him back to the beginning, and giving him the trial period, even though he’s not conducting himself properly.

original: Saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, telling him to conduct himself properly.

original: nissāya te vatthabbanti.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—🔽nissāya te vatthabbanti, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: nissāya te vatthabbanti  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa karaṇa  nissāya te vatthabbanti saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: If you agree, remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.🔽Kataṁ saṅghena seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ—
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya  katam saṅghena seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kamma
translated: If you don’t, then speak up.

original: nissāya te vatthabbanti.
analyzed: nissāya te vatthabbanti
translated: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka, telling him to conduct himself properly.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’“

original: 2.1. Adhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: adhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: . The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

original: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammañca hoti avinaya kammañca duvūpasantañca
translated: “When a legal procedure of demotion has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Asammukhā kataṁ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: asammukhā katam hoti appaṭipucchā katam hoti appaṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammañca hoti avinaya kammañca duvūpasantañca
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: anāpattiyā katam hoti a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti
translated: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammañca hoti avinaya kammañca duvūpasantañca
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.”🔽. The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures is finished.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: When a demotion transaction has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Acodetvā kataṁ hoti, asāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: a codetvā katam hoti a sāretvā katam hoti āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti
translated: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.🔽When a demotion transaction has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammañca hoti avinaya kammañca duvūpasantañca  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: asammukhā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: asammukhā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done without the person having admitted to an offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.🔽When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: appaṭipucchā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done without questioning the person, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: appaṭiññāya katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done without the person having admitted to an offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: anāpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done about something that’s not an offense, it’s not done legitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.🔽When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done about an offense that should not be acknowledged, it’s not done legitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.🔽When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done about an offense that’s been confessed, it’s not done legitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.🔽When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: acodetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: a codetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s not done legitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.🔽When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: asāretvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: a sāretvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s not done legitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.🔽When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: It is done without having accused the person of an offense. It is done illegitimately. It is done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.🔽Adhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam adhamma kammañca hoti avinaya kammañca duvūpasantañca  adhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: When a demotion transaction has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:🔽The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures is finished.

original: 2.2. Dhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: dhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: 13. The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a demotion transaction has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Sammukhā kataṁ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: sammukhā katam hoti paṭipucchā katam hoti paṭiññāya katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca
translated: It’s done face-to-face. It’s done with questioning. It’s done with admission.🔽When a demotion transaction has these three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: āpattiyā katam hoti desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adesitāya āpattiyā katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca
translated: The offense has been committed. The offense is one that should be confessed. The offense hasn’t been confessed.🔽When a demotion transaction has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed:

original: Codetvā kataṁ hoti, sāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: codetvā katam hoti sāretvā katam hoti āpattim āropetvā katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca
translated: It’s done after accusing the person of their offense. It’s done after reminding the person of their offense. It’s done after charging the person with their offense.🔽When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed:

original: sammukhā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: sammukhā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: It’s done in the presence of the accused. It’s done legitimately. It’s done by a unanimous assembly.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed:🔽When a demotion transaction has another three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed:

original: paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: paṭipucchā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done legitimately; it’s done with a complete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s reversible.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…🔽paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe  paṭiññāya katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also reversible.🔽it’s done by admission; it’s done legitimately; it’s done with a complete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s reversible.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…🔽āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe  āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also reversible.🔽it’s done legitimately; it’s done with a complete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s reversible.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also reversible.🔽it’s done legitimately; it’s done with a complete assembly.

original: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s reversible.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…🔽adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pe  a desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also reversible.🔽it’s done legitimately; it’s done with a complete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has these five qualities, it’s reversible.

original: codetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: codetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: When a legal procedure of demotion has another five qualities, it’s also reversible.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pe  aparehi pi bhikkhave pe
translated: “These are the five faculties …🔽“These are the five faculties …

original: sāretvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave …pe….
analyzed: sāretvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave pe
translated: When a procedure of demotion has these qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.🔽Āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca  āpattim āropetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.🔽It’s done without having accused the person of their offense.🔽When a procedure of demotion has these qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ niyassakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam niyassa kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.

original: Dhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: It’s done after accusing the person of their offense.🔽When a procedure of demotion has these qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.”🔽The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures is finished.

original: 2.3. Ākaṅkhamānachakka
analyzed: ākaṅkhamāna chakka
translated: . The group of six on wishing

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him:

original: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
analyzed: bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ vivāda kārakaḥ bhassa kārako saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakaḥ
translated: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

original: bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: bālaḥ hoti a byattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ an apadānaḥ
translated: he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, lacking in boundaries;

original: gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi—
analyzed: gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he’s committed an offense;🔽he’s socializing with householders in a way that’s inappropriate for monastics.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him.

original: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
analyzed: adhi sīle sīla vipannaḥ hoti ajjhācāre ācāra vipannaḥ hoti ati diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhi vipannaḥ hoti
translated: He’s failed in the higher morality; he’s failed in conduct; he’s failed in view.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him.

original: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—
analyzed: buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: He disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him.

original: Tiṇṇaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: tiṇṇa bhikkhave bhikkhūna ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three kinds of monks:

original: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;🔽eko bālo hoti, abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: ekaḥ bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ vivāda kārakaḥ bhassa kārako saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakaḥ  ekaḥ bālaḥ hoti abyattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ an apadānaḥ
translated: one who is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

original: eko gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi—
analyzed: ekaḥ gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: one who is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;🔽and one who is constantly socializing with householders in a way that is not in accordance with the Teaching.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against these three kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three other kinds of monks:

original: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ adhi sīle sīla vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ajjhācāre ācāra vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ati diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhi vipannaḥ hoti
translated: one who has failed in the higher morality; one who has failed in conduct; and one who has failed in view.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, also do a procedure of demotion against three other kinds of monks.

original: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—
analyzed: ekaḥ buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: One who disparages the Buddha, one who disparages the Teaching, and one who disparages the Sangha.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ niyassa kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Ākaṅkhamānachakkaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: ākaṅkhamāna chakkam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of six on wishing is finished.

original: 2.4. Aṭṭhārasavatta
analyzed: aṭṭhārasavatta
translated: . The eighteen kinds of conduct

original: Niyassakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: niyassa kamma katena bhikkhave bhikkhunā sammā
translated: A monk who’s had a legal procedure of demotion done against himself should conduct himself properly.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—🔽na upasampādetabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā  na upasampādetabba
translated: This is the proper conduct:🔽he shouldn’t give the full ordination,

original: na nissayo dātabbo,🔽na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo,
analyzed: na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ  na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t give formal support,🔽he shouldn’t accept being looked after by a novice monk,

original: na bhikkhunovādakasammuti sāditabbā,
analyzed: na bhikkhunā uvādaka sammuti sāditabbā
translated: he shouldn’t consent to being a tutor of the nuns,

original: sammatenapi bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā.
analyzed: sammatena api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovaditabbā
translated: and he shouldn’t tutor the nuns even if he’s been asked to do so.

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassakammaṁ kataṁ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassa kammam katam hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā
translated: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;

original: aññā vā tādisikā,
analyzed: aññā vā tādisikā
translated: or similar to them,

original: tato vā pāpiṭṭhatarā;
analyzed: tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatarā
translated: or even worse.

original: kammaṁ na garahitabbaṁ,
analyzed: kammam na
translated: You should not criticize the legal procedure,

original: kammikā na garahitabbā.
analyzed: kammikā na garahitabbā
translated: nor the monks who did it.

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatho ṭhapetabbo,🔽na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā,🔽na savacanīyaṁ kātabbaṁ,🔽na anuvādo paṭṭhapetabbo,
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaḥ ṭhapetabbaḥ  na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā  na savacanīyam  na anuvādaḥ paṭṭhapetabbo
translated: You should not cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk,🔽nor cancel his invitation ceremony,🔽nor give him a讯质,

original: na okāso kārāpetabbo,🔽na codetabbo,
analyzed: na okāsaḥ kārāpetabbo  na codetabbaḥ
translated: nor press him,🔽nor force him to do anything,

original: na sāretabbo,
analyzed: na sāretabbaḥ
translated: nor accuse him,🔽nor remind him of his failure.

original: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabban”ti.
analyzed: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti
translated: You should not associate with other monks.”

original: Niyassakamme aṭṭhārasavattaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: niyassa kamme aṭṭhārasa vattam niṭṭhita
translated: The eighteen duties in the legal procedure of demotion are finished.

original: Atha kho saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ akāsi—
analyzed: atha kho saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam akāsi
translated: The Sangha did a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,

original: nissāya te vatthabbanti.🔽So saṅghena niyassakammakato kalyāṇamitte sevamāno bhajamāno payirupāsamāno uddisāpento🔽paripucchanto bahussuto hoti, āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito
analyzed: nissāya te vatthabbanti  so saṅghena niyassa kamma kataḥ kalyāṇa mitte sevamānaḥ bhajamānaḥ payirupāsamānaḥ uddisāpentaḥ  paripucchantaḥ bahu sutaḥ hoti āgata āgamaḥ dhamma dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ mātikā dharo paṇḍito
translated: and he should stay dependent on them.”

original: viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
analyzed: viyattaḥ medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhā kāmo
translated: After the Sangha had done a legal procedure of demotion against him, he associated with good monks, developed his mind, and became learned and a keeper of the Dhamma, the Monastic Law, and the rules. He became knowledgeable and skilled, and was able to give answers in accordance with the Dhamma. He became dear to and beloved by the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.🔽He became dear to and beloved by gods and humans.

original: Sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evam vadeti
translated: He conducts himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and he asks the monks for forgiveness, saying,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi.
analyzed: aha āvuso saṅghena niyassa kamma kato sammā vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi
translated: “Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against me, but I’ve conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released.

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?🔽Bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti  bhikkhū bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ
translated: What should I do now?”

original: pe….
analyzed: pe
translated: The monks told the Buddha. …

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambhetu.🔽2.5. Nappaṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasaka
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam paṭippassambhetu  na paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasaka
translated: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. …🔽The group of eighteen on not to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Upasampādeti, nissayaṁ deti, sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
analyzed: upasampādeti nissayam deti sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadati
translated: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted.🔽When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassa kammam katam hoti tam āpattim āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;

original: kammaṁ garahati, kammike garahati—
analyzed: kammam garahati kammike garahati
translated: he disparages the procedure; he disparages those who did the procedure.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṁ karoti, anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṁ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti pavāraṇam ṭhapeti savacanīyam karoti anuvādam paṭṭhapeti okāsam kāreti codeti sāreti bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he does a regular monk’s observance-day ceremony; he does a regular monk’s invitation ceremony; he gives full admission; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he gives a novice monk to look after.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Nappaṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽2.6. Paṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasaka
analyzed: na paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasakam niṭṭhita  paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasaka
translated: . The group of eighteen on to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:

original: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṁ deti, na sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
analyzed: na upasampādeti na nissayam deti na sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti na bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovadati
translated: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t accept a novice monk; he doesn’t accept a trainee nun for the training; he doesn’t give advice to the nuns, even if asked for it;

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ na āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassa kammam katam hoti tam āpattim na āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;

original: kammaṁ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
analyzed: kammam na garahati kammike na garahati
translated: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure;

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañca haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: “When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṁ karoti, na anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṁ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti na pavāraṇam ṭhapeti na savacanīyam karoti na anuvādam paṭṭhapeti na okāsam kāreti na codeti na sāreti na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t do legal acts toward a regular monk; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t submit to the authority of a regular monk; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted.”

original: Paṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: niṭṭhita
translated: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: “And, monks, it should be lifted like this.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, seyyasakena bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ
analyzed: tena bhikkhave seyyasakena bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅga
translated: The monk Seyyasaka should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: karitvā vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: karitvā vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: He should then pay respect at the feet of the more senior monks, sit down on his haunches, raise his joined palms, and say,

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: aha bhante saṅghena niyassa kamma kato sammā vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against me. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that procedure to be lifted.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam seyyasakaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena niyassa kamma kato sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Seyyasaka has been given a legal procedure of demotion by the Sangha. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that procedure to be lifted.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambheyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam paṭippassambheyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam seyyasakaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena niyassa kamma kato sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Seyyasaka, who’s been given this resolution by the Sangha, is now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

original: Saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam paṭippassambheti  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi so tuṇhassa
translated: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.🔽Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter.

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam seyyasakaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena niyassa kamma kato sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Seyyasaka, who’s been given this resolution by the Sangha, is now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

original: Saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi so tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift that legal procedure of demotion against him.

original: Tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter.

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam seyyasakaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena niyassa kamma kato sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Seyyasaka, who’s been given a legal procedure of demotion by the Sangha, is now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

original: Saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi so tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Paṭippassaddhaṁ saṅghena seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṁ.
analyzed: paṭippassaddham saṅghena seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassa kamma
translated: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”

original: Niyassakammaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: niyassa kammam niṭṭhitam dutiya
translated: The second section on the legal procedure of demotion is finished.

original: 3. Pabbājanīyakamma
analyzed: pabbājanīya kamma
translated: The legal procedure of banishment

original: Tena kho pana samayena assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāsikā honti alajjino pāpabhikkhū.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena assajipunabbasukāḥ nāma kīṭāgirismim āvāsikāḥ honti alajjinaḥ pāpa bhikkhū
translated: At that time at Kīṭāgiri there were resident monks called Assaji and Punabbasuka who were shameless and wicked.

original: Te evarūpaṁ anācāraṁ ācaranti—
analyzed: te evarūpam anācāram ācaranti
translated: They engage in this kind of misconduct:🔽They plant and have planted flower trees,

original: mālāvacchaṁ ropentipi ropāpentipi, siñcantipi siñcāpentipi, ocinantipi ocināpentipi,🔽ganthentipi ganthāpentipi, ekatovaṇṭikamālaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṁ
analyzed: mālā vaccham ropentipi ropāpentipi siñcantipi siñcāpentipi ocinantipi ocināpentipi  ekatas vaṇṭika mālam karontipi kārāpentipi ubhatas vaṇṭika māla
translated: they water and have watered them, they prune and have pruned them,

original: karontipi kārāpentipi, mañjarikaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, vidhūtikaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi,
analyzed: karontipi kārāpentipi mañjarikam karontipi kārāpentipi vidhūtikam karontipi kārāpentipi
translated: they make and have made single-stalk garlands, double-stalk garlands,🔽and multi-stalk garlands,🔽they make and have made flower arrangements,

original: vaṭaṁsakaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, āveḷaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, uracchadaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi.🔽Te kulitthīnaṁ kuladhītānaṁ kulakumārīnaṁ kulasuṇhānaṁ kuladāsīnaṁ ekatovaṇṭikamālaṁ
analyzed: vaṭasakam karontipi kārāpentipi āveḷam karontipi kārāpentipi uracchadam karontipi kārāpentipi  te kulitthīnam kula dhītānam kula kumārīnam kula suṇhānam kula dāsīnam
translated: they make and have made flower wreaths,🔽they make and have made flower canopies,🔽they make and have made flower valances,

original: harantipi harāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṁ harantipi harāpentipi, mañjarikaṁ harantipi
analyzed: ubhatas vaṇṭika mālam harantipi harāpentipi mañjarikam harantipi
translated: they make and have made flower tassels,🔽they take and have taken single-stalk garlands🔽from the wives, daughters, and female slaves of other families,🔽they take and have taken double-stalk garlands,🔽multi-stalk garlands, flower arrangements,

original: harāpentipi, vidhūtikaṁ harantipi harāpentipi, vaṭaṁsakaṁ harantipi harāpentipi,
analyzed: vidhūtikam harantipi harāpentipi vaṭasakam harantipi harāpentipi
translated: flower wreaths, flower canopies,

original: āveḷaṁ harantipi harāpentipi, uracchadaṁ harantipi harāpentipi.🔽Te kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi saddhiṁ ekabhājanepi
analyzed: āveḷam harantipi harāpentipi uracchadam harantipi harāpentipi  te kulitthīhi kula dhītāhi kula kumārīhi kula suṇhāhi kula dāsīhi saddhim eka bhājane pi
translated: they take them away and have them taken away, they take them away and have them carried away.🔽They eat from the same plate as the women of the house, the daughters of the house, the female slaves of the house, and the female guests of the house.

original: bhuñjanti, ekathālakepi pivanti, ekāsanepi nisīdanti, ekamañcepi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇāpi
analyzed: bhuñjanti ekathā ālake api pivanti eka āsane api nisīdanti eka mañce pi tuvaṭṭenti
translated: They drink from the same cup as them, they sit on the same seat as them, they lie on the same bed as them, they cover themselves with the same bedspread as them,

original: tuvaṭṭenti, ekapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, vikālepi
analyzed: tuvaṭṭenti eka pāvuraṇā api tuvaṭṭenti ekattharaṇa pāvuraṇā api tuvaṭṭenti vikāle pi
translated: they cover themselves with the same blanket as them, they cover themselves with the same bedspread and blanket as them. They eat at the wrong time,

original: bhuñjanti, majjampi pivanti, mālāgandhavilepanampi dhārenti, naccantipi, gāyantipi,
analyzed: bhuñjanti majjam pivanti mālā gandha vilepanam pi dhārenti naccanti pi gāyanti pi
translated: they drink alcohol, they wear garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics, they dance, sing,

original: vādentipi, lāsentipi;🔽naccantiyāpi naccanti, naccantiyāpi gāyanti, naccantiyāpi vādenti, naccantiyāpi lāsenti;🔽gāyantiyāpi naccanti, gāyantiyāpi gāyanti, gāyantiyāpi vādenti, gāyantiyāpi lāsenti;
analyzed: vādentipi lāsentipi  naccantiyā api naccanti naccantiyā api gāyanti naccantiyā api vādenti naccantiyā api lāsenti  gāyantiyā api naccanti gāyantiyā api gāyanti gāyantiyā api vādenti gāyantiyā api lāsenti
translated: and play music, and they act as prostitutes.🔽They dance for those who dance, they sing for those who sing, they play music for those who play music, they act as prostitutes for those who act as prostitutes.🔽They dance for those who sing, they sing for those who sing, they play music for those who play music, they act as prostitutes for those who act as prostitutes.

original: vādentiyāpi naccanti, vādentiyāpi gāyanti, vādentiyāpi vādenti, vādentiyāpi lāsenti;
analyzed: vādentiyā api naccanti vādentiyā api gāyanti vādentiyā api vādenti vādentiyā api lāsenti
translated: They dance for those who play music, they sing for those who play music, they play music for those who play music, they act as prostitutes for those who act as prostitutes.

original: lāsentiyāpi naccanti, lāsentiyāpi gāyanti, lāsentiyāpi vādenti, lāsentiyāpi lāsenti;
analyzed: lāsentiyā api naccanti lāsentiyā api gāyanti lāsentiyā api vādenti lāsentiyā api lāsenti
translated: They dance while making others dance, they sing while making others sing, they play instruments while making others play instruments, they make others dance,🔽they play with eight-rowed chess, they play with ten-rowed chess, they play in the air, they play on a path with turns,

original: aṭṭhapadepi kīḷanti, dasapadepi kīḷanti, ākāsepi kīḷanti, parihārapathepi kīḷanti,
analyzed: aṭṭhapade pi kīḷanti dasapade pi kīḷanti ākāse pi kīḷanti parihāra pathe pi kīḷanti

translated: they play with a toy fish, they play with a toy horse, they play with a toy bull, they play with a toy goat, they play with a toy sheep, they play with a toy deer, they play with a toy bird, they play with a toy monkey,

original: hatthissapi purato dhāvanti, assassapi purato dhāvanti, rathassapi purato dhāvantipi ādhāvantipi;
analyzed: hatthissa api puratas dhāvanti assassa api puratas dhāvanti rathassa api puratas dhāvanti pi ādhāvanti pi
translated: The elephants ran in front of them, the horses ran in front of them, the chariots ran in front of them, and ran alongside them.

original: usseḷentipi, apphoṭentipi, nibbujjhantipi, muṭṭhīhipi yujjhanti;
analyzed: usseḷenti pi apphoṭenti pi nibbujjhanti pi muṭṭhīhi pi yujjhanti
translated: They were shouting, clapping their hands, and jumping. They were fighting with their fists.

original: raṅgamajjhepi saṅghāṭiṁ pattharitvā naccakiṁ evaṁ vadanti—
analyzed: raṅga majjhe api saṅghāṭim pattharitvā evam vadanti
translated: In the middle of the arena they spread out their outer robes and said to the dancers,

original: “idha, bhagini, naccassū”ti;🔽nalāṭikampi denti;
analyzed: idha bhagini naccassu iti  denti
translated: “Dance here, sister!”🔽They gave them head massages.

original: vividhampi anācāraṁ ācaranti.
analyzed: vividham pi anācāram ācaranti
translated: They misbehaved in many ways.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kāsīsu vassaṁvuṭṭho sāvatthiṁ gacchanto bhagavantaṁ dassanāya yena kīṭāgiri tadavasari.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ bhikkhu kāsīsu vassa vuṭṭhaḥ sāvatthim gacchantaḥ bhagavantam dassanāya yena kīṭāgiri tat avasari
translated: On one occasion a monk who had completed the rainy-season residence in Kāsī was going to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha. He arrived at Kīṭāgiri.

original: Atha kho so bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kīṭāgiriṁ piṇḍāya🔽pāvisi pāsādikena abhikkantena paṭikkantena ālokitena vilokitena samiñjitena pasāritena,
analyzed: atha kho saḥ bhikkhu pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya kīṭāgirim piṇḍāya  pāvisi pāsādikena abhikkantena paṭikkantena ālokitena vilokitena samiñjitena pasāritena
translated: In the morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Kīṭāgiri for alms.🔽He was pleasant to meet, easy to talk to, and agreeable in his behavior.

original: okkhittacakkhu iriyāpathasampanno.
analyzed: okkhitta cakkhu iriyāpatha sampanno
translated: He was modest, content, secluded, detached, and he had a sense of urgency.

original: Manussā taṁ bhikkhuṁ passitvā evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: manussā tam bhikkhum passitvā evam āhasu
translated: When people saw him, they said,

original: “kvāyaṁ abalabalo viya mandamando viya bhākuṭikabhākuṭiko viya?
analyzed: kva ayam abala balaḥ viya manda mandaḥ viya bhākuṭika bhākuṭikaḥ viya
translated: “Who is this, walking around like a weakling, like a fool, like a simpleton?

original: Ko imassa upagatassa piṇḍakampi dassati?
analyzed: kaḥ imassa upagatassa piṇḍakam pi dassati
translated: Who would give almsfood to him?

original: Amhākaṁ pana ayyā assajipunabbasukā saṇhā sakhilā sukhasambhāsā mihitapubbaṅgamā ehisvāgatavādino abbhākuṭikā uttānamukhā pubbabhāsino.
analyzed: amhākam pana ayyā saṇhā sa khilā sukha sambhāsā mihita pubbaṅgamāḥ ehi svāgata vādinaḥ abbhākuṭikāḥ uttāna mukhāḥ pubba bhāsinaḥ
translated: But our Venerables Assaji and Punabbasuka are gentle, pleasant, smiling, and friendly, and they speak politely and pleasantly. They are not surly and they look at you straight in the face.

original: Tesaṁ kho nāma piṇḍo dātabbo”ti.🔽Addasā kho aññataro upāsako taṁ bhikkhuṁ kīṭāgirismiṁ piṇḍāya carantaṁ;
analyzed: tesam kho nāma piṇḍaḥ dātabbo ti  addasā kho aññataraḥ upāsako tam bhikkhum kīṭāgirismim piṇḍāya caranta
translated: It’s them that almsfood should be given to.”🔽A certain lay follower saw that monk walking for alms in Kīṭāgiri.

original: disvāna yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṁ bhikkhuṁ abhivādetvā etadavoca—🔽“api, bhante, piṇḍo labbhatī”ti?
analyzed: disvāna yena saḥ bhikkhu tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tam bhikkhum abhivādetvā etat avoca  api bhante piṇḍaḥ labbhati iti
translated: He approached him, bowed,🔽and said, “Sir, are you getting any almsfood?”

original: “Na kho, āvuso, piṇḍo labbhatī”ti.
analyzed: na kho āvuso piṇḍaḥ labbhati iti
translated: “No, I’m not.”

original: “Ehi, bhante, gharaṁ gamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: ehi bhante gharam gamissāma ati
translated: “Come, let’s go to my house.”

original: Atha kho so upāsako taṁ bhikkhuṁ gharaṁ netvā bhojetvā etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ upāsakaḥ tam bhikkhum gharam netvā bhojetvā etat avoca
translated: After taking the monk to his house and feeding him, he said,

original: “kahaṁ, bhante, ayyo gamissatī”ti?
analyzed: kaha bhante ayyaḥ gamissati iti
translated: “Sir, where are you going?”

original: “Sāvatthiṁ kho ahaṁ, āvuso, gamissāmi bhagavantaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
analyzed: sāvatthim kho aha āvuso gamissāmi bhagavantam dassanāya ati
translated: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.”

original: “Tena hi, bhante, mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda, evañca vadehi—
analyzed: tena hi bhante mama vacanena bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vanda evañca vadehi
translated: “Then, Sir, in my name bow with your head to his feet.

original: ‘duṭṭho, bhante, kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāso.
analyzed: duṭṭhaḥ bhante kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsaḥ
translated: ‘Sir, the monastery at Kīṭāgiri is corrupt.

original: Assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāsikā alajjino pāpabhikkhū.
analyzed: assajipunabbasukāḥ nāma kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsikāḥ alajjinaḥ pāpa bhikkhū
translated: The bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka live there.

original: Te evarūpaṁ anācāraṁ ācaranti—
analyzed: te evarūpam anācāram ācaranti
translated: They misbehave in this way:

original: mālāvacchaṁ ropentipi ropāpentipi, siñcantipi siñcāpentipi, ocinantipi ocināpentipi,🔽ganthentipi ganthāpentipi, ekatovaṇṭikamālaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṁ🔽karontipi kārāpentipi, mañjarikaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, vidhūtikaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi,
analyzed: mālā vaccham ropentipi ropāpentipi siñcantipi siñcāpentipi ocinantipi ocināpentipi  ekatas vaṇṭika mālam karontipi kārāpentipi ubhatas vaṇṭika māla  karontipi kārāpentipi mañjarikam karontipi kārāpentipi vidhūtikam karontipi kārāpentipi
translated: they plant and tend flower trees; they water and weed them;🔽they make and have others make single- and multi-colored garlands;🔽they make and have others make flower arrangements;🔽they make and have others make incense and oil ointments;

original: vaṭaṁsakaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, āveḷaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi, uracchadaṁ karontipi kārāpentipi.
analyzed: vaṭasakam karontipi kārāpentipi āveḷam karontipi kārāpentipi uracchadam karontipi kārāpentipi
translated: they make and have others make fans; they make and have others make fly whisks with handles; they make and have others make bags for holding the whisks.

original: Te kulitthīnaṁ kuladhītānaṁ kulakumārīnaṁ kulasuṇhānaṁ kuladāsīnaṁ ekatovaṇṭikamālaṁ🔽harantipi harāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṁ harantipi harāpentipi, mañjarikaṁ harantipi
analyzed: te kulitthīnam kula dhītānam kula kumārīnam kula suṇhānam kula dāsīnam  ubhatas vaṇṭika mālam harantipi harāpentipi mañjarikam harantipi
translated: They took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,

original: harāpentipi, vidhūtikaṁ harantipi harāpentipi, vaṭaṁsakaṁ harantipi harāpentipi,🔽āveḷaṁ harantipi harāpentipi, uracchadaṁ harantipi harāpentipi.
analyzed: vidhūtikam harantipi harāpentipi vaṭasakam harantipi harāpentipi  āveḷam harantipi harāpentipi uracchadam harantipi harāpentipi
translated: and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,🔽and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls, the wives, the female slaves, of the families,

original: Te kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi saddhiṁ ekabhājanepi🔽bhuñjanti, ekathālakepi pivanti, ekāsanepi nisīdanti, ekamañcepi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇāpi🔽tuvaṭṭenti, ekapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, vikālepi
analyzed: te kulitthīhi kula dhītāhi kula kumārīhi kula suṇhāhi kula dāsīhi saddhim eka bhājane pi  bhuñjanti ekathā ālake api pivanti eka āsane api nisīdanti eka mañce pi tuvaṭṭenti  tuvaṭṭenti eka pāvuraṇā api tuvaṭṭenti ekattharaṇa pāvuraṇā api tuvaṭṭenti vikāle pi

original: vādentipi, lāsentipi;
analyzed: vādentipi lāsentipi
translated: and they took away the garlands of the women, the girls,

original: naccantiyāpi naccanti, naccantiyāpi gāyanti, naccantiyāpi vādenti, naccantiyāpi lāsenti …pe…
analyzed: naccantiyā api naccanti naccantiyā api gāyanti naccantiyā api vādenti naccantiyā api lāsenti pe
translated: When a woman is dancing, they dance; when a woman is singing, they sing; when a woman is playing a musical instrument, they play a musical instrument; when a woman is flirting, they flirt. …

original: (cakkaṁ kātabbaṁ).
analyzed: cakkam
translated: (The rest is to be expanded in the same way as above.)

original: Lāsentiyāpi naccanti, lāsentiyāpi gāyanti, lāsentiyāpi vādenti, lāsentiyāpi lāsenti;
analyzed: lāsentiyā api naccanti lāsentiyā api gāyanti lāsentiyā api vādenti lāsentiyā api lāsenti
translated: When a woman is flirting, they dance; when a woman is flirting, they sing; when a woman is flirting, they play a musical instrument; when a woman is flirting, they flirt.🔽They play with eight- or ten-rowed dice; they play with leaf dice; they play with painted dice; they play with dice marked with dots;

analyzed: aṭṭhapade pi kīḷanti dasapade pi kīḷanti ākāse pi kīḷanti parihāra pathe pi kīḷanti  santikāya api kīḷanti khalikāya api kīḷanti ghaṭikāya api kīḷanti salāka hatthena api kīḷanti  akkhena api kīḷanti paṅga cīrena api kīḷanti vaṅkakena api kīḷanti mokkha cikāya api kīḷanti
translated: they play with ball games; they play with toy plows; they play with toy windmills; they play with toy measures; they play with toy carriages;
