analyzed: ciṅgulakena api kīḍanti patta āḷhakena api kīḍanti rathakena api kīḍanti dhanukena api kīḍanti 🔽akkharikāya api kīḷanti manesikāya api kīḷanti yathāvajjena api kīḷanti
translated: they play with toy bows; they play with toy spinning wheels; they play with toy threshing apparatuses; they play with toy oxen; they play with toy deer; they play with toy elephants; they play with toy horses; they play with toy cows; they play with toy goats; they play with toy sheep; they play with toy fighting rams; they play with toy fighting cocks; they play with toy fighting fish; they play with toy fighting dogs; they play with toy fighting men;🔽they play with toy bows; they play with toy spinning wheels; they play with toy threshing apparatuses; they play with toy oxen; they play with toy deer; they play with toy elephants; they play with toy horses; they play with toy cows; they play with toy goats; they play with toy sheep; they play with toy fighting rams; they play with toy fighting cocks; they play with toy fighting fish; they play with toy fighting dogs; they play with toy fighting men; they play with toy bows; they play with toy spinning wheels; they play with toy threshing apparatuses; they play with toy oxen; they play with toy deer; they play with toy elephants; they play with toy horses; they play with toy cows; they play with toy goats; they play with toy sheep; they play with toy fighting rams; they play with toy fighting cocks; they play with toy fighting fish; they play with toy fighting dogs; they play with toy fighting men; they play with toy bows; they play with toy spinning wheels; they play with toy threshing apparatuses; they play with toy oxen; they play with toy deer; they play with toy elephants; they play with toy horses

original: hatthismimpi sikkhanti, assasmimpi sikkhanti, rathasmimpi sikkhanti, dhanusmimpi sikkhanti, tharusmimpi sikkhanti;🔽hatthissapi purato dhāvanti, assassapi purato dhāvanti, rathassapi purato dhāvantipi ādhāvantipi;
analyzed: hatthismim pi sikkhanti assasmim pi sikkhanti rathasmim pi sikkhanti dhanusmim pi sikkhanti tharusmim pi sikkhanti  hatthissa api puratas dhāvanti assassa api puratas dhāvanti rathassa api puratas dhāvanti pi ādhāvanti pi
translated: They train in elephants, horses, and chariots; in swords, arrows, and shields;🔽and they run in front of elephants, horses, and chariots; they run alongside and behind them;

original: usseḷentipi, apphoṭentipi, nibbujjhantipi, muṭṭhīhipi yujjhanti;
analyzed: usseḷenti pi apphoṭenti pi nibbujjhanti pi muṭṭhīhi pi yujjhanti
translated: they run in front of and behind troops of soldiers.

original: raṅgamajjhepi saṅghāṭiṁ pattharitvā naccakiṁ evaṁ vadanti—
analyzed: raṅga majjhe api saṅghāṭim pattharitvā evam vadanti
translated: They spread out their outer robes in the middle of a public square and say,

original: “idha, bhagini, naccassū”ti;
analyzed: idha bhagini naccassu iti
translated: ‘Dance here, Sister.’

original: nalāṭikampi denti;
analyzed: denti
translated: They give them palm-treacle.

original: vividhampi anācāraṁ ācaranti.
analyzed: vividham pi anācāram ācaranti
translated: And they behave in a way that’s contrary to the true Teaching.

original: Yepi te, bhante, manussā pubbe saddhā ahesuṁ pasannā tepi etarahi assaddhā appasannā.
analyzed: ye pi te bhante manussā pubbe saddhāḥ ahesum pasannā te pi etarahi assaddhāḥ appasannā
translated: Those who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it.

original: Yānipi tāni saṅghassa pubbe dānapathāni tānipi etarahi upacchinnāni.
analyzed: yāni api tāni saṅghassa pubbe dāna pathāni tāni api etarahi upacchinnāni
translated: The Sangha’s regular offerings have been stopped.

original: Riñcanti pesalā bhikkhū, nivasanti pāpabhikkhū.
analyzed: riñcanti pesalāḥ bhikkhū nivasanti pāpa bhikkhū
translated: Good monks have left and bad monks are staying on.

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā kīṭāgiriṁ bhikkhū pahiṇeyya, yathāyaṁ kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāso saṇṭhaheyyā’”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā kīṭāgirim bhikkhū pahiṇeyya yathā ayam kīṭāgirismin āvāsaḥ saṇṭhaheyya ati
translated: It would be good if the Buddha sent some monks to Kīṭāgiri, so that the monastery there can be established.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho so bhikkhu tassa upāsakassa paṭissuṇitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi.
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho saḥ bhikkhu tassa upāsakassa paṭissuṇitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi
translated: “Yes, Venerable Sir,” that monk replied. He got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and set out for Sāvatthī.🔽When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery, bowed, sat down,

original: Anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṁ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Āciṇṇaṁ kho panetaṁ buddhānaṁ bhagavantānaṁ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ paṭisammodituṁ.
analyzed: anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanam anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  āciṇṇam kho pana etam buddhānam bhagavantānam āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhim paṭisammoditu
translated: and the Buddha, as is natural for Buddhas, welcomed him with an appropriate talk.

original: Atha kho bhagavā taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tam bhikkhum etat avoca
translated: The Buddha then said to that monk,

original: “kacci, bhikkhu, khamanīyaṁ, kacci yāpanīyaṁ,
analyzed: kacci bhikkhu khamanīya kacci yāpanīya
translated: “I hope you’re keeping well, monk, I hope you’re getting by.

original: kaccisi appakilamathena addhānaṁ āgato,
analyzed: kaccisi appa kilamathena addhānam āgataḥ
translated: I hope you’ve come without any trouble,

original: kuto ca tvaṁ bhikkhu āgacchasī”ti?
analyzed: kutas ca tvam bhikkhu āgacchasi iti
translated: and where are you coming from?”

original: “Khamanīyaṁ, bhagavā, yāpanīyaṁ, bhagavā;
analyzed: khamanīya bhagavā yāpanīya bhagavā
translated: “I’m keeping well, Sir, I’m getting by.

original: appakilamathena ca ahaṁ, bhante, addhānaṁ āgato.
analyzed: appa kilamathena ca aha bhante addhānam āgataḥ
translated: And I’ve come without any trouble, Sir.

original: Idhāhaṁ, bhante, kāsīsu vassaṁvuṭṭho sāvatthiṁ āgacchanto bhagavantaṁ dassanāya yena kīṭāgiri tadavasariṁ.
analyzed: idha āha bhante kāsīsu vassavuṭṭhaḥ sāvatthim āgacchantaḥ bhagavantam dassanāya yena kīṭāgiri tat avasari
translated: I spent the rainy season in Kāsī and then went to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhante, pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kīṭāgiriṁ piṇḍāya pāvisiṁ.🔽Addasā kho maṁ, bhante, aññataro upāsako kīṭāgirismiṁ piṇḍāya carantaṁ;
analyzed: atha khvā āha bhante pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya kīṭāgirim piṇḍāya pāvisi  addasā kho ma bhante aññataraḥ upāsako kīṭāgirismiṃ piṇḍāya caranta
translated: I entered Kīṭāgiri for alms.

original: disvāna yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā etadavoca—🔽‘api, bhante, piṇḍo labbhatī’ti.
analyzed: disvāna yena aham tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā mam abhivādetvā etat avoca  api bhante piṇḍaḥ labbhati iti
translated: A lay follower saw me and said,🔽‘Sir, have you received any alms?’

original: ‘Na kho, āvuso, piṇḍo labbhatī’ti.
analyzed: na kho āvuso piṇḍaḥ labbhati iti
translated: ‘No, I haven’t.’

original: ‘Ehi, bhante, gharaṁ gamissāmā’ti.
analyzed: ehi bhante gharam gamissāma ati
translated: ‘Come, let’s go to my house.’

original: Atha kho, bhante, so upāsako maṁ gharaṁ netvā bhojetvā etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhante saḥ upāsakaḥ mam gharam netvā bhojetvā etat avoca
translated: He then took me to his house, gave me a meal, and said,

original: ‘kahaṁ, bhante, ayyo gamissatī’ti?
analyzed: kaha bhante ayyaḥ gamissati iti
translated: ‘Sir, where will you go now?’

original: ‘Sāvatthiṁ kho ahaṁ, āvuso, gamissāmi bhagavantaṁ dassanāyā’ti.
analyzed: sāvatthim kho aha āvuso gamissāmi bhagavantam dassanāya ati
translated: ‘I’ll go to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.’

original: ‘Tena hi, bhante, mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda, evañca vadehi—
analyzed: tena hi bhante mama vacanena bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vanda evañca vadehi
translated: ‘Well then, sir, bow your head in respect at the feet of the Buddha and say this:

original: “duṭṭho, bhante, kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāso.
analyzed: duṭṭhaḥ bhante kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsaḥ
translated: “The monastery at Kīṭāgiri is corrupt, reverend Sir.

original: Assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāsikā alajjino pāpabhikkhū.
analyzed: assajipunabbasukāḥ nāma kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsikāḥ alajjinaḥ pāpa bhikkhū
translated: The resident monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are shameless and wicked monks.

original: Te evarūpaṁ anācāraṁ ācaranti—
analyzed: te evarūpam anācāram ācaranti
translated: They behave badly,

original: mālāvacchaṁ ropentipi ropāpentipi …pe…
analyzed: mālāvaccham pe
translated: planting and tending parks and groves,

original: vividhampi anācāraṁ ācaranti.
analyzed: vividham pi anācāram ācaranti
translated: and they engage in various kinds of bad behavior.

original: Yepi te, bhante, manussā pubbe saddhā ahesuṁ pasannā tepi etarahi assaddhā appasannā.
analyzed: ye pi te bhante manussā pubbe saddhāḥ ahesum pasannā te pi etarahi assaddhāḥ appasannā
translated: Those people who previously had faith and confidence no longer do so.

original: Yānipi tāni saṅghassa pubbe dānapathāni tānipi etarahi upacchinnāni.
analyzed: yāni api tāni saṅghassa pubbe dāna pathāni tāni api etarahi upacchinnāni
translated: The Sangha’s regular offerings have been stopped.

original: Riñcanti pesalā bhikkhū, nivasanti pāpabhikkhū.
analyzed: riñcanti pesalāḥ bhikkhū nivasanti pāpa bhikkhū
translated: The good monks have left and the wicked monks are staying on.

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā kīṭāgiriṁ bhikkhū pahiṇeyya, yathāyaṁ kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāso saṇṭhaheyyā”’ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā kīṭāgirim bhikkhū pahiṇeyya yathā ayam kīṭāgirismin āvāsaḥ saṇṭhaheyya ati
translated: It would be good, reverend Sir, if the Buddha would send monks to Kīṭāgiri, so that the monastery there can be settled.”

original: Tato ahaṁ, bhagavā, āgacchāmī”ti.
analyzed: tatas aha bhagavān āgacchāmi iti
translated: I’ll come back then.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṁ āvāsikā alajjino pāpabhikkhū?🔽Te evarūpaṁ anācāraṁ ācaranti—🔽mālāvacchaṁ ropentipi …pe…🔽vividhampi anācāraṁ ācaranti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave assajipunabbasukāḥ nāma kīṭāgirismim āvāsikāḥ alajjinaḥ pāpa bhikkhū  te evarūpam anācāram ācaranti  mālāvaccham pe  vividham pi anācāram ācaranti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are acting like this?”🔽“It’s true, Sir.”🔽“How can they do this?🔽They plant flower trees,🔽and they act in this shameless way?

original: Yepi te manussā pubbe saddhā ahesuṁ pasannā tepi etarahi assaddhā appasannā?🔽Yānipi tāni saṅghassa pubbe dānapathāni tānipi etarahi upacchinnāni?🔽Riñcanti pesalā bhikkhū, nivasanti pāpabhikkhū”ti?
analyzed: ye pi te manussā pubbe saddhāḥ ahesum pasannā te pi etarahi assaddhāḥ appasannā  yāni api tāni saṅghassa pubbe dāna pathāni tāni api etarahi upacchinnāni  riñcanti pesalāḥ bhikkhū nivasanti pāpa bhikkhū ti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the shameless scoundrels Assaji and Punabbasuka are acting like this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “Yes, it’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—🔽“ananucchavikaṁ …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān  an anucchavikam pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them …

original: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā evarūpaṁ anācāraṁ ācarissanti—🔽mālāvacchaṁ ropessantipi ropāpessantipi, siñcissantipi siñcāpessantipi, ocinissantipi
analyzed: katham hi nāma te bhikkhave mogha purisāḥ evarūpam anācāram ācarissanti  mālāvaccham ropessantipi ropāpessantipi siñcissantipi siñcāpessantipi ocinissantipi
translated: “How can those foolish men act like this?🔽They plant and water flowering trees,🔽they tie garlands,

original: ocināpessantipi, ganthessantipi ganthāpessantipi, ekatovaṇṭikamālaṁ karissantipi
analyzed: ocināpessanti ipi ganthessantipi ganthāpessantipi ekatovaṇṭika mālam karissantipi
translated: they make garlands into bouquets,

original: kārāpessantipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṁ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, mañjarikaṁ karissantipi🔽kārāpessantipi, vidhūtikaṁ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, vaṭaṁsakaṁ karissantipi kārāpessantipi,
analyzed: kārāpessanti pi ubhatovaṇṭika mālam karissanti pi kārāpessanti pi mañjarikam karissanti pi  kārāpessantipi vidhūtikam karissantipi kārāpessantipi vaṭasakam karissantipi kārāpessantipi
translated: They will make garlands of flowers with a single strand, or have them made. They will make garlands of flowers with two strands,🔽or have them made. They will make garlands of flowers with three strands,🔽or have them made. They will make garlands of flowers with four strands,🔽or have them made. They will make garlands of flowers with five strands,

original: āveḷaṁ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, uracchadaṁ karissantipi kārāpessantipi.🔽Te kulitthīnaṁ kuladhītānaṁ kulakumārīnaṁ kulasuṇhānaṁ kuladāsīnaṁ ekatovaṇṭikamālaṁ
analyzed: āveḷam karissantipi kārāpessantipi uracchadam karissantipi kārāpessantipi  te kulitthīnam kula dhītānam kula kumārīnam kula suṇhānam kula dāsīnam
translated: or have them made.🔽They will take garlands of flowers with a single strand,

original: harissantipi harāpessantipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṁ harissantipi harāpessantipi, mañjarikaṁ
analyzed: ubhatas vaṇṭika mālam harissantipi harāpessantipi mañjarika
translated: or have them taken, from women of good families, from girls of good families, from young boys of good families, or from female slaves of good families. They will take garlands of flowers with two strands,🔽or have them taken, from women of good families, from girls of good families, from young boys of good families, or from female slaves of good families. They will take garlands of flowers with three strands,🔽or have them taken, from women of good families, from girls of good families, from young boys of good families, or from female slaves of good families. They will take garlands of flowers with four strands,🔽or have them taken, from women of good families, from girls of good families, from young boys of good families, or from female slaves of good families. They will take garlands of flowers with five strands,

original: harissantipi harāpessantipi, vidhūtikaṁ harissantipi harāpessantipi, vaṭaṁsakaṁ harissantipi🔽harāpessantipi, āveḷaṁ harissantipi harāpessantipi, uracchadaṁ harissantipi harāpessantipi.
analyzed: vidhūtikam harissantipi harāpessantipi vaṭasakam harissantipi 🔽āveḷam harissantipi harāpessantipi uracchadam harissantipi harāpessantipi
translated: or have them taken, from women of good families, from girls of good families, from young boys of good families, or from female slaves of good families.

original: Te kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi saddhiṁ ekabhājanepi
analyzed: te kulitthīhi kula dhītāhi kula kumārīhi kula suṇhāhi kula dāsīhi saddhim eka bhājane pi
translated: They will eat from the same plate as low-caste women,

original: bhuñjissanti, ekathālakepi pivissanti, ekāsanepi nisīdissanti, ekamañcepi tuvaṭṭissanti,
analyzed: bhuñjissanti ekathā ālake api pivissanti eka āsane api nisīdissanti eka mañce pi tuvaṭṭissanti
translated: drink from the same vessel, sit on the same seat, lie on the same bed,

original: ekattharaṇāpi tuvaṭṭissanti, ekapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭissanti, ekattharaṇapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭissanti,
analyzed: eka pāvuraṇā api tuvaṭṭissanti eka ttharaṇa pāvuraṇā api tuvaṭṭissanti
translated: use the same rug, use the same cloth, use the same rug and cloth,

original: vikālepi bhuñjissanti, majjampi pivissanti, mālāgandhavilepanampi dhāressanti, naccissantipi,
analyzed: vikāle api bhuñjissanti majjampi pivissanti mālā gandha vilepanam pi dhāressanti naccissanti pi
translated: eat at the wrong time, drink alcohol, wear garlands, scents, and cosmetics, dance,

original: gāyissantipi, vādessantipi, lāsessantipi;🔽naccantiyāpi naccissanti, naccantiyāpi gāyissanti, naccantiyāpi vādessanti, naccantiyāpi lāsessanti;🔽gāyantiyāpi naccissanti, gāyantiyāpi gāyissanti, gāyantiyāpi vādessanti, gāyantiyāpi lāsessanti;
analyzed: gāyissanti ipi vādessanti ipi lāsessanti ipi  naccantiyā api naccissanti naccantiyā api gāyissanti naccantiyā api vādessanti naccantiyā api lāsessanti  gāyantiyā api naccissanti gāyantiyā api gāyissanti gāyantiyā api vādessanti gāyantiyā api lāsessanti
translated: sing, play instruments, and perform.🔽They will dance for dancers, sing for singers, play instruments for musicians, and perform for performers.

original: vādentiyāpi naccissanti, vādentiyāpi gāyissanti, vādentiyāpi vādessanti, vādentiyāpi lāsessanti;
analyzed: vādentiyā api naccissanti vādentiyā api gāyissanti vādentiyā api vādessanti vādentiyā api lāsessanti
translated: They will dance for those who dance, sing for those who sing, play instruments for those who play instruments, and perform for those who perform.🔽They will dance for those who dance, sing for those who sing, play instruments for those who play instruments, and perform for those who perform.

original: lāsentiyāpi naccissanti, lāsentiyāpi gāyissanti, lāsentiyāpi vādessanti, lāsentiyāpi lāsessanti;🔽aṭṭhapadepi kīḷissanti, dasapadepi kīḷissanti, ākāsepi kīḷissanti, parihārapathepi🔽kīḷissanti, santikāyapi kīḷissanti, khalikāyapi kīḷissanti, ghaṭikāyapi kīḷissanti,🔽salākahatthenapi kīḷissanti, akkhenapi kīḷissanti, paṅgacīrenapi kīḷissanti, vaṅkakenapi🔽kīḷissanti mokkhacikāyapi kīḷissanti, ciṅgulakenapi kīḷissanti, pattāḷhakenapi kīḷissanti,
analyzed: lāsentiyā api naccissanti lāsentiyā api gāyissanti lāsentiyā api vādessanti lāsentiyā api lāsessanti  aṭṭhapade pi kīḷissanti dasapade pi kīḷissanti ākāse pi kīḷissanti parihāra pathe pi  kīḷissanti santikāya api kīḷissanti khalikāya api kīḷissanti ghaṭikāya api kīḷissanti  salāka hatthena api kīḷissanti akkhena api kīḷissanti paṅga cīrena api kīḷissanti vaṅkakena pi  kīḷissanti mokkhacikāya api kīḷissanti ciṅgulakena api kīḷissanti patta āḷhakena api kīḷissanti
translated: They will dance for them, sing for them, play music for them, and perform for them;

original: rathakenapi kīḷissanti, dhanukenapi kīḷissanti, akkharikāyapi kīḷissanti, manesikāyapi🔽kīḷissanti, yathāvajjenapi kīḷissanti;
analyzed: rathakena api kīḷissanti dhanukena api kīḷissanti akkharikāya api kīḷissanti manesikāya api  kīḷissanti yathāvat jena api kīḷissanti
translated: they will play with them at eight- or ten-rowed chess, at draught-chess, at lines-across-the-knee chess, at leaf chess, at turning-sticks chess, at turning-boards chess, at turning-tops chess, at hand-writing, at guessing-numbers, at finger-spelling, at word-guessing, at word-spelling, at word-guessing in the dark, at ball-games, at target-shooting, at archery, at stick-fighting, at mock-fighting, at mock-sword-fighting, at mock-elephant-riding, at mock-horse-riding, at mock-chariot-riding, at mock-running, at mock-jumping, at mock-diving, at mock-swimming, at mock-catching, at mock-thievery, at mock-kings, at mock-lawsuits, at mock-drinking, at mock-eating, at mock-singing, at mock-dancing, at mock-playing-music, at mock-performing, at mock-laughing, at mock-crying, at mock-sleeping, at mock-waking, at mock-sitting, at mock-lying-down, at mock-standing, at mock-walking, at mock-talking, at mock-keeping-silent, at mock-going-forward, at mock-going-back;

original: hatthismimpi sikkhissanti, assasmimpi sikkhissanti, rathasmimpi sikkhissanti, dhanusmimpi sikkhissanti, tharusmimpi sikkhissanti;
analyzed: hatthismim pi sikkhissanti assasmim pi sikkhissanti rathasmim pi sikkhissanti dhanusmim pi sikkhissanti tharusmim pi sikkhissanti
translated: they will train in elephant-riding, in horse-riding, in chariot-riding, in archery, in swordsmanship;

original: hatthissapi purato dhāvissanti, assassapi purato dhāvissanti, rathassapi purato dhāvissantipi ādhāvissantipi;
analyzed: hatthissa api puratas dhāvissanti assassa api puratas dhāvissanti rathassa api puratas dhāvissanti pi ādhāvissanti pi
translated: They will run in front of elephants, horses, and chariots.🔽They will run in front of them, run alongside them, and run behind them.

original: usseḷessantipi, apphoṭessantipi, nibbujjhissantipi, muṭṭhīhipi yujjhissanti;
analyzed: usseḷessanti pi apphoṭessanti pi nibbujjhissanti pi muṭṭhīhi pi yujjhissanti
translated: They will make the chariots turn, make them stop, and make them crash.

original: raṅgamajjhepi saṅghāṭiṁ pattharitvā naccakiṁ evaṁ vakkhanti—
analyzed: raṅga majjhe api saṅghāṭim pattharitvā naccakim evam vakkhanti
translated: They will spread out their outer robes in the middle of a public square and say to dancers,

original: ‘idha, bhagini, naccassū’ti;
analyzed: idha bhagini naccassu iti
translated: ‘Dance here, sister.’

original: nalāṭikampi dassanti;
analyzed: nalāṭikam pi dassanti
translated: They will show off their foreheads.

original: vividhampi anācāraṁ ācarissanti.
analyzed: vividham pi anācāram ācarissanti
translated: They will behave in all kinds of improper ways.”

original: (…) Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: “This will not lead to confidence in those without it …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking them …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā sāriputtamoggallāne āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā sāriputta moggallāne āmantesi
translated: he addressed the monks:🔽“Sāriputta and Moggallāna, go to Kīṭāgiri and do a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri. They are your pupils.”

original: “gacchatha tumhe, sāriputtā, kīṭāgiriṁ gantvā assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṁ karotha, tumhākaṁ ete saddhivihārino”ti.
analyzed: gacchatha tumhe sāriputtā kīṭāgirim gantvā assajipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīya kammam karotha tumhākam ete saddhivihārino ti
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: “Kathaṁ mayaṁ, bhante, assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṁ karoma, caṇḍā te bhikkhū pharusā”ti?
analyzed: katham bhante assajipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīya kammam karoma caṇḍā te bhikkhū pharusā ati
translated: “How can we do a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from the Kīṭāgiri country? They’re fierce and rough.”

original: “Tena hi tumhe, sāriputtā, bahukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ gacchathā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi tumhe sāriputtāḥ bahukehi bhikkhūhi saddhim gacchatha ati
translated: “Well then, Sāriputta and Moggallāna, go together with a large sangha.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho sāriputtamoggallānā bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhanta iti kho sāriputta moggallānāḥ bhagavato paccassosu
translated: “Yes, Sir.”

original: “Evañca pana, bhikkhave, kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: “And, monks, it should be done like this.

original: paṭhamaṁ assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū codetabbā, codetvā sāretabbā, sāretvā āpattiṁ āropetabbā, āpattiṁ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: paṭhamam assa jipu nabbasukā bhikkhū codetabbā codetvā sāretabbā sāretvā āpattim āropetabbā āpattim āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: First you should accuse the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka. They should then be reminded of what they’ve done, before they’re charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ime assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū kuladūsakā pāpasamācārā.🔽Imesaṁ pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
analyzed: ime assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū kula dūsakā pāpa samācārā  imesam pāpakā samācārā dissanti ca iva suyyanti ca
translated: The monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are corrupters of families and badly behaved.🔽Their bad behavior has been seen and heard about.

original: Kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
analyzed: kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ca iva suyyanti ca
translated: The families corrupted by them have been seen and heard about.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya—
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ assajipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri,

original: na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṁ vatthabbanti.
analyzed: na assa jipu nabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismim vatthabbanti
translated: prohibiting them from staying in the same residence as the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ime assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū kuladūsakā pāpasamācārā.🔽Imesaṁ pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
analyzed: ime assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū kula dūsakā pāpa samācārā  imesam pāpakā samācārā dissanti ca iva suyyanti ca
translated: The monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are corrupters of families and badly behaved.🔽Their bad behavior has been seen and heard about.

original: Kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
analyzed: kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ca iva suyyanti ca
translated: The families corrupted by them have been seen and heard about.

original: Saṅgho assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ assajipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīya kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri,

original: na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṁ vatthabbanti.
analyzed: na assa jipu nabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismim vatthabbanti
translated: prohibiting them from staying in the same residence as the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṁ vatthabbanti, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati assa jipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyassa kammassa assa jipu nabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismim vatthabbanti saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri, prohibiting them from staying in the same residence as the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka, should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.🔽The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri, prohibiting them from staying in the same residence as the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: A second time I speak on this matter …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: A third time I speak on this matter.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ime assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū kuladūsakā pāpasamācārā.🔽Imesaṁ pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
analyzed: ime assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū kula dūsakā pāpa samācārā  imesam pāpakā samācārā dissanti ca iva suyyanti ca
translated: These monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are corrupters of families and badly behaved.🔽Their bad behavior has been seen and heard about,

original: Kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.🔽Saṅgho assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ca iva suyyanti ca  saṅghaḥ assajipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīya kammam karoti
translated: and the families corrupted by them have been seen and heard about.

original: na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṁ vatthabbanti.
analyzed: na assa jipu nabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismim vatthabbanti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of banishing them from Kīṭāgiri, prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṁ vatthabbanti, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati assa jipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyassa kammassa assa jipu nabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismim vatthabbanti saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of banishing these monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri, prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri, should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Kataṁ saṅghena assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṁ—
analyzed: katam saṅghena assajipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīya kamma
translated: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing these monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri, prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.

original: na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṁ vatthabbanti.
analyzed: na assa jipu nabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismim vatthabbanti
translated: that the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka should not stay at Kīṭāgiri.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: Since there is no objection, I will regard this as approved.”

original: 3.1. Adhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: adhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: . Twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

original: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: “When a procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Asammukhā kataṁ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: asammukhā katam hoti appaṭipucchā katam hoti appaṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of banishment has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: anāpattiyā katam hoti a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who has confessed their offense. …🔽. …

original: acodetvā kataṁ hoti, asāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽asammukhā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a codetvā katam hoti a sāretvā katam hoti āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti pe  asammukhā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done without accusing the person; it is done without reminding the person of their offense; it is done without charging the person with the offense. …🔽it is done not face-to-face; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: appaṭipucchā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  appaṭiññāya katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  anāpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done without questioning the person; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done without the admission of the person; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done against one who is not an offense; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽acodetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  a codetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done against one whose confession has not been received; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done against one whose confession has been received; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done without accusing the person; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: asāretvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a sāretvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done without reminding the person of their offense; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.🔽Adhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.2. Dhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca  adhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita  dhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: When a procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:🔽The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures is finished.🔽12. The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Sammukhā kataṁ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: sammukhā katam hoti paṭipucchā katam hoti paṭiññāya katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: it’s done face-to-face, it’s done with questioning, it’s done with admission.🔽When a procedure of banishment has these three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Āpattiyā kataṁ hoti desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽codetvā kataṁ hoti, sāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽sammukhā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: āpattiyā katam hoti desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adesitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe  codetvā katam hoti sāretvā katam hoti āpattim āropetvā katam hoti pe  sammukhā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  paṭipucchā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  paṭiññāya katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: A legal procedure of acknowledgment that should be done for an offense that is clearable by confession …🔽A legal procedure of further penalty that is done after accusing, after reminding, after charging an offense …🔽A legal procedure done in the presence of the accused that is legitimate and has a complete assembly …🔽A procedure of searching for a hidden fault that is legitimate and has a complete assembly …🔽A procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense that is legitimate and has a complete assembly …🔽A procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense that is legitimate and has a complete assembly …🔽

original: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽codetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe 🔽a desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe 🔽codetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe

original: sāretvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: sāretvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done legitimately; it’s done with a complete assembly. …

original: āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: āpattim āropetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: it’s done legitimately; it’s done with a complete assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ pabbājanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam pabbājanīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Dhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽3.3. Ākaṅkhamānacuddasaka
analyzed: dhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita  ākaṅkhamāna cuddasaka
translated: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures is finished.🔽13. The group of fourteen on wishing

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him:

original: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
analyzed: bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ vivāda kārakaḥ bhassa kārako saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakaḥ
translated: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

original: bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: bālaḥ hoti a byattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ an apadānaḥ
translated: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he’s committed an offense;

original: gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi—
analyzed: gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has three other qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him:

original: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
analyzed: adhi sīle sīla vipannaḥ hoti ajjhācāre ācāra vipannaḥ hoti ati diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhi vipannaḥ hoti

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya

translated: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has three other qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

original: Kāyikena davena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena davena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena davena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: kāyikena davena samannāgataḥ hoti vācasikena davena samannāgataḥ hoti kāyika vācasikena davena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha; he’s contemptuous of the monks; he’s contemptuous of the Teaching; he’s contemptuous of the Monastic Law; he’s contemptuous of the training; he’s contemptuous of the person; he’s contemptuous of the Teaching and the Monastic Law; he’s contemptuous of the Monastic Law and the training; he’s contemptuous of the training and the person; he’s contemptuous of the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the training; he’s contemptuous of the Monastic Law, the training, and the person; he’s contemptuous of the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the person; he’s contemptuous of the Teaching, the training, and the person; he’s contemptuous of the Monastic Law, the training, and the person; he’s contemptuous of the Teaching, the Monastic Law, the training, and the person.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him.

original: Kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: kāyikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti vācasikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti kāyika vācasikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: he has bad bodily conduct; he has bad verbal conduct; he has bad bodily and verbal conduct.🔽When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya 🔽aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him.

original: Kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgataḥ hoti vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgataḥ hoti kāyika vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: He’s physically violent, verbally violent, and physically and verbally violent.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him.

original: Kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti—🔽imehi, kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgataḥ hoti vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgataḥ hoti kāyika vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgataḥ hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: He has wrong livelihood by body, by speech, and by body and speech.🔽When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him.

original: Tiṇṇaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: tiṇṇa bhikkhave bhikkhūna ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing a monk who has three qualities:

original: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;🔽eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: ekaḥ bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ vivāda kārakaḥ bhassa kārako saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakaḥ  ekaḥ bālaḥ hoti abyattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ an apadānaḥ
translated: One who is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

original: eko gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi—
analyzed: ekaḥ gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: one who is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;🔽one who is socializing with householders in a way that is improper for monastics.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, also do a procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks:

original: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ adhi sīle sīla vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ajjhācāre ācāra vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ati diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhi vipannaḥ hoti
translated: one who has failed in the higher morality; one who has failed in conduct; one who has failed in view.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, also do a procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks:

original: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—
analyzed: ekaḥ buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: One who disparages the Buddha, one who disparages the Teaching, and one who disparages the Sangha.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, also do a procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks:

original: Eko kāyikena davena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena davena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena davena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ kāyikena davena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ vācasikena davena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ kāyika vācasikena davena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: one who is quarrelsome and argumentative, one who is ignorant and incompetent, and one who is divisive and backbiting.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.🔽Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya 🔽aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Eko kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ kāyikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ vācasikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ kāyika vācasikena anācārena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: One who has bad behavior with the body, one who has bad behavior with speech, and one who has bad behavior with both body and speech.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it can do a legal procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it can also do a procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks:

original: Eko kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ kāyika vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: One who harms with the body, one who harms with speech, and one who harms with both body and speech.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it can do a legal procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it can also do a procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks:

original: Eko kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgataḥ hoti ekaḥ kāyika vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: One of them is practicing wrong livelihood by body, one of them is practicing wrong livelihood by speech, and one of them is practicing wrong livelihood by body and speech.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If it wishes, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of banishing any of these three kinds of monks.

original: Ākaṅkhamānacuddasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: ākaṅkhamāna cuddasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of fourteen on wishing is finished.

original: 3.4. Aṭṭhārasavatta
analyzed: aṭṭhārasavatta
translated: . The eighteen duties

original: Pabbājanīyakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: pabbājanīya kamma katena bhikkhave bhikkhunā sammā
translated: A monk who’s had a legal procedure of banishment done against himself should behave properly.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—🔽na upasampādetabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā  na upasampādetabba
translated: This is the proper behavior:🔽he shouldn’t give the full ordination,

original: na nissayo dātabbo,🔽na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo,
analyzed: na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ  na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t give formal support,🔽he shouldn’t accept being looked after by a novice monk,

original: na bhikkhunovādakasammuti sāditabbā,
analyzed: na bhikkhunā uvādaka sammuti sāditabbā
translated: he shouldn’t consent to being a tutor of the nuns,

original: sammatenapi bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā.🔽Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
analyzed: sammatena api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovaditabbā  yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīya kammam katam hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā
translated: and he shouldn’t tutor the nuns even if he’s been asked to do so.🔽He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;

original: aññā vā tādisikā,
analyzed: aññā vā tādisikā
translated: he shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;

original: tato vā pāpiṭṭhatarā;🔽kammaṁ na garahitabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatarā  kammam na
translated: he shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;🔽he shouldn’t criticize the procedure;

original: kammikā na garahitabbā.
analyzed: kammikā na garahitabbā
translated: he shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatho ṭhapetabbo,
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaḥ ṭhapetabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony for a regular monk.🔽You shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony for a regular monk.

original: na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā,🔽na savacanīyaṁ kātabbaṁ,🔽na anuvādo paṭṭhapetabbo,
analyzed: na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā  na savacanīyam  na anuvādaḥ paṭṭhapetabbo
translated: You shouldn’t do a legal procedure with a regular monk.🔽You shouldn’t do a legal procedure of information against a regular monk.🔽You shouldn’t ask a regular monk for permission to correct him.🔽You shouldn’t correct a regular monk.

original: na okāso kāretabbo,🔽na codetabbo,🔽na sāretabbo,
analyzed: na okāsaḥ kāretabbo  na codetabbaḥ  na sāretabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t remind a regular monk of his offense.

original: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabban”ti.
analyzed: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti
translated: You shouldn’t associate inappropriately with regular monks.”

original: Pabbājanīyakamme aṭṭhārasavattaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: pabbājanīya kamme aṭṭhārasa vattam niṭṭhita
translated: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of banishment are finished.

original: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho kīṭāgiriṁ gantvā assajipunabbasukānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṁ akāsi—
analyzed: atha kho sāriputta moggallāna ppamukhaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ kīṭāgirim gantvā assa jipu nabbasukānam bhikkhūnam kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīya kammam akāsi
translated: The Sangha did a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from the monastery at Kīṭāgiri,

original: na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṁ vatthabbanti.🔽Te saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattanti, na lomaṁ pātenti, na netthāraṁ vattanti;
analyzed: na assa jipu nabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismim vatthabbanti  te saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma katāḥ na sammā vattanti na lomam pātenti na netthāram vattanti
translated: saying that they should not stay in the monastery at Kīṭāgiri.🔽When the Sangha had done a legal procedure of banishing them, they did not behave properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, nor did they ask the monks for forgiveness.

original: na bhikkhū khamāpenti, akkosanti, paribhāsanti;🔽chandagāmitā dosagāmitā mohagāmitā bhayagāmitā pāpenti;
analyzed: na bhikkhū khamāpenti akkosanti paribhāsanti  chanda gāmi tā dosa gāmi tā moha gāmi tā bhaya gāmi tā
translated: They abused and insulted the monks,🔽and they associated with householders in a way that was unbecoming to them.

original: pakkamantipi, vibbhamantipi.
analyzed: pakkamanti pi vibbhamanti pi
translated: They left and they disrobed.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: Those monks who had few desires … complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattissanti, na lomaṁ pātessanti, na netthāraṁ vattissanti;
analyzed: katham hi nāma assa jipu nabbasukāḥ bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma katāḥ na sammā vattissanti na lomam pātessanti na netthāram vattissanti
translated: “How can the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka act like this when the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishment against them? They don’t behave properly, they don’t make amends, they don’t admit their offenses.

original: na bhikkhū khamāpessanti, akkosissanti, paribhāsissanti;🔽chandagāmitā dosagāmitā mohagāmitā bhayagāmitā pāpessanti;🔽pakkamissantipi, vibbhamissantipī”ti.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.🔽Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: na bhikkhū khamāpessanti akkosissanti paribhāsissanti  chanda gāmi tā dosa gāmi tā moha gāmi tā bhaya gāmi tā pāpessanti  pakkamissanti pi vibbhamissanti pi iti  atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu  atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: They don’t ask the monks for forgiveness, but instead abuse and revile them.

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattanti, na lomaṁ pātenti, na netthāraṁ vattanti;🔽na bhikkhū khamāpenti, akkosanti, paribhāsanti;
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave assa jipu nabbasukāḥ bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma katāḥ na sammā vattanti na lomam pātenti na na itthāram vattanti 🔽na bhikkhū khamāpenti akkosanti paribhāsanti
translated: They side with whomever they like, and they side with whomever they dislike. They side with whomever they’re familiar with, and they side with whomever they’re unfamiliar with. They side with whomever they approve of, and they side with whomever they don’t approve of. They side with whomever they respect, and they side with whomever they don’t respect. They side with whomever they love, and they side with whomever they don’t love. They side with whomever they like, and they side with whomever they don’t like. They side with whomever they’re fond of, and they side with whomever they’re not fond of. They side with whomever they admire, and they side with whomever they don’t admire. They side with whomever they’re jealous of, and they side with whomever they’re not jealous of. They side with whomever they’re angry with, and they side with whomever they’re not angry with. They side with whomever they’re contemptuous of, and they side with whomever they’re not contemptuous of. They side with whomever they’re scared of, and they side with whomever they’re not scared of. They side with whomever they’re scared of losing, and they side with whomever they’re not scared of losing. They side with whomever they’re scared of being separated from, and they side with whomever they’re not scared of being separated from. They side with whomever they’re scared of being abandoned by, and they side with whomever they’re not scared of being abandoned by. They side with whomever they’re scared of being criticized by, and they side with whomever they’re not scared of being criticized by. They side with whomever they’re scared of being corrected by, and they side with whomever they’re not scared of being corrected by. They side with whomever they’re scared of being reproached by, and they

original: chandagāmitā dosagāmitā mohagāmitā bhayagāmitā pāpenti;
analyzed: chanda gāmi tā dosa gāmi tā moha gāmi tā bhaya gāmi tā
translated: They’re acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.

original: pakkamantipi, vibbhamantipī”ti?
analyzed: pakkamanti pi vibbhamanti pi iti
translated: They’re leaving and they’re disrobing.”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—🔽“ananucchavikaṁ …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān  an anucchavikam pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them …🔽“How can those foolish men act like this?

original: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattissanti, na lomaṁ pātessanti, na netthāraṁ vattissanti;
analyzed: katham hi nāma te bhikkhave mogha purisāḥ saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma katāḥ na sammā vattissanti na lomam pātessanti na netthāram vattissanti
translated: They’re not conducting themselves properly and are not making amends for their offense.

original: na bhikkhū khamāpessanti, akkosissanti, paribhāsissanti;
analyzed: na bhikkhū khamāpessanti akkosissanti paribhāsissanti
translated: They’re not asking the monks for forgiveness, but are abusing and insulting them.

original: chandagāmitā dosagāmitā mohagāmitā bhayagāmitā pāpessanti;
analyzed: chanda gāmi tā dosa gāmi tā moha gāmi tā bhaya gāmi tā pāpessanti
translated: They’re acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.

original: pakkamissantipi, vibbhamissantipi.
analyzed: pakkamissanti pi vibbhamissanti pi
translated: They’re leaving and they’re disrobing.

original: Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: It’s not suitable …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking them …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetu.🔽3.5. Nappaṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasaka
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ pabbājanīya kammam paṭippassambhetu 🔽na paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasaka
translated: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of banishment.🔽The group of eighteen on not to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has five qualities, a procedure of banishment against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Upasampādeti, nissayaṁ deti, sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
analyzed: upasampādeti nissayam deti sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadati
translated: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of banishment against him shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of banishment against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;

original: kammaṁ garahati, kammike garahati—
analyzed: kammam garahati kammike garahati
translated: he disparages the procedure; he disparages those who did the procedure.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of banishment against him shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishment against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṁ karoti, anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṁ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti pavāraṇam ṭhapeti savacanīyam karoti anuvādam paṭṭhapeti okāsam kāreti codeti sāreti bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: he gives the full admission, he gives the formal support, he has a novice monk attend on him, he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns, he instructs the nuns even though he’s been appointed, he goes along with a schism in the Sangha, he goes along with one who’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense, he goes along with one who’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense.🔽When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of banishment against him shouldn’t be lifted.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Pabbājanīyakamme nappaṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba  pabbājanīya kamme na paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasakam
translated: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of banishment is finished.

original: 3.6. Paṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasaka
analyzed: paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasaka
translated: 1.18 The group of eighteen on to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of banishment against him should be lifted:

original: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṁ deti, na sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
analyzed: na upasampādeti na nissayam deti na sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti na bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovadati
translated: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t accept being appointed as a teacher of the nuns; even if appointed, he doesn’t instruct the nuns; he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of banishment against him should be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ na āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam  yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim na āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of banishment against him should be lifted:

original: kammaṁ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
analyzed: kammam na garahati kammike na garahati
translated: he hasn’t committed the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he hasn’t committed an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he hasn’t committed an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of banishment against him should be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishment against him should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṁ karoti, na anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṁ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti na pavāraṇam ṭhapeti na savacanīyam karoti na anuvādam paṭṭhapeti na okāsam kāreti na codeti na sāreti na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: He doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk, doesn’t cancel his invitation ceremony, doesn’t make him do the observance-day ceremony, doesn’t make him do the invitation ceremony, doesn’t make him do a legal procedure, doesn’t make him recognize an offense, doesn’t make him make amends for an offense, doesn’t make him give up a bad view, doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.🔽When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishment against him should be lifted:

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Pabbājanīyakamme paṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba  pabbājanīya kamme paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of eighteen on the lifting of the legal procedure of banishment is finished.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Tena, bhikkhave, pabbājanīyakammakatena bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave  tena bhikkhave pabbājanīya kamma katena bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅga
translated: And it should be lifted like this.🔽The monk who’s had the procedure of banishment done should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

original: karitvā vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: karitvā vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing me.

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: aha bhante saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma kataḥ sammā vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishment against me, but I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that procedure to be lifted.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma kataḥ sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishment against monk so-and-so,

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam paṭippassambheyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift that procedure.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma kataḥ sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishment against monk so-and-so,

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of banishment against the monk so-and-so.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of banishment against the monk so-and-so should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.🔽Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya  dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.🔽For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīya kamma kataḥ sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk so-and-so, who’d been given a legal procedure of banishment by the Sangha, has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He’s asked for the lifting of that procedure.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kammam paṭippassambheti  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of banishment against the monk so-and-so.🔽Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of banishment against the monk so-and-so should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
