translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Paṭippassaddhaṁ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṁ.
analyzed: paṭippassaddham saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīya kamma
translated: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of banishment against the monk so-and-so.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’“

original: Pabbājanīyakammaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: pabbājanīya kammam niṭṭhitam tatiya
translated: The procedure consisting of sending back to the beginning is finished.

original: 4. Paṭisāraṇīyakamma
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya kamma
translated: The procedure consisting of reconciliation

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sudhammo macchikāsaṇḍe cittassa gahapatino āvāsiko hoti, navakammiko dhuvabhattiko.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sudhammaḥ macchikāsaṇḍe cittassa gahapatino āvāsikaḥ hoti nava kammikaḥ dhuva bhattiko
translated: At that time Venerable Sudhamma was the resident monk of Citta the householder in Macchikāsaṇḍa. He was in charge of building work and received a regular meal.

original: Yadā citto gahapati saṅghaṁ vā gaṇaṁ vā puggalaṁ vā nimantetukāmo hoti tadā na āyasmantaṁ sudhammaṁ anapaloketvā saṅghaṁ vā gaṇaṁ vā puggalaṁ vā nimanteti.
analyzed: yadā cittaḥ gahapati saṅgham vā gaṇam vā puggalam vā nimantetu kāmaḥ hoti tadā naḥ āyasmantam sudhammam an apaloketvā saṅgham vā gaṇam vā puggalam vā nimanteti
translated: Whenever Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without first checking with Sudhamma.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā therā bhikkhū, āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno,
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahlāḥ therāḥ bhikkhū āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno
translated: On one occasion a number of senior monks were staying at Macchikāsaṇḍa: Venerable Sāriputta, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna,

original: āyasmā ca mahākaccāno, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko, āyasmā ca mahākappino, āyasmā ca mahācundo,
analyzed: āyasmā ca mahākaccānaḥ āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhikaḥ āyasmā ca mahākappino āyasmā ca mahācundaḥ
translated: Venerable Mahākaccāna, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita, Venerable Mahākappina, Venerable Mahācunda,

original: āyasmā ca anuruddho, āyasmā ca revato, āyasmā ca upāli, āyasmā ca ānando, āyasmā
analyzed: āyasmā ca anuruddhaḥ āyasmā ca revataḥ āyasmā ca upāli āyasmā ca ānandaḥ āyasmā
translated: Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Revata, Venerable Upāli, Venerable Ānanda,

original: ca rāhulo, kāsīsu cārikaṁ caramānā yena macchikāsaṇḍo tadavasaruṁ.🔽Assosi kho citto gahapati therā kira bhikkhū macchikāsaṇḍaṁ anuppattāti.
analyzed: ca kāsīsu cārikam caramānā yena  assosi kho cittaḥ gahapati therā kira bhikkhū macchikāsaṇḍam anuppattā ti
translated: and Rāhula, wandering in the Kāsi country, arrived at Macchikāsaṇḍa.🔽The householder Citta heard that the senior monks had arrived at Macchikāsaṇḍa.

original: Atha kho citto gahapati yena therā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā there bhikkhū abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho cittaḥ gahapati yena therāḥ bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā there bhikkhū abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: He then went to them, bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cittaṁ gahapatiṁ āyasmā sāriputto dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho cittam gahapatim āyasmā sāriputto dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi
translated: and the Venerable Sāriputta instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

original: Atha kho citto gahapati āyasmatā sāriputtena dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito there bhikkhū etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho cittaḥ gahapati āyasmatā sāriputtena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitaḥ samādapitaḥ samuttejitaḥ sampahasitaḥ there bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: Then Citta said to the senior monks,

original: “adhivāsentu me, bhante, therā svātanāya āgantukabhattan”ti.
analyzed: me bhante therā
translated: “Venerables, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the newly arrived monks.”

original: Adhivāsesuṁ kho therā bhikkhū tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesum kho therāḥ bhikkhū tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The senior monks accepted by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho citto gahapati therānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā there
analyzed: atha kho cittaḥ gahapati therānam bhikkhūnam adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā there
translated: Then Citta, understanding that the senior monks had accepted, got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated them with his right side toward them, and left.

original: bhikkhū abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yenāyasmā sudhammo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: bhikkhū abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā yena ayasmā sudhammo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: He bowed down, circumambulated him with his right side toward him, and then went to Sudhamma.🔽He bowed down to Sudhamma

original: āyasmantaṁ sudhammaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.🔽Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho citto gahapati āyasmantaṁ sudhammaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: āyasmantam sudhammam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi  ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho cittaḥ gahapati āyasmantam sudhammam etat avoca
translated: and stood to one side.

original: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, ayyo sudhammo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ therehī”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhante ayyaḥ sudhammaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim therehi iti
translated: “Venerable, would you care to take a meal with me tomorrow together with the senior monks?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudhammo—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudhammaḥ
translated: Sudhamma thought,

original: “pubbe khvāyaṁ citto gahapati yadā saṅghaṁ vā gaṇaṁ vā puggalaṁ vā nimantetukāmo na maṁ anapaloketvā saṅghaṁ vā gaṇaṁ vā puggalaṁ vā nimanteti;
analyzed: pubbe khvā ayam cittaḥ gahapati yadā saṅgham vā gaṇam vā puggalam vā nimantetu kāmaḥ na mama an apaloketvā saṅgham vā gaṇam vā puggalam vā nimanteti
translated: “In the past, when Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he never invited me without first informing me.

original: sodāni maṁ anapaloketvā there bhikkhū nimantesi;
analyzed: sodāni mama an apaloketvā there bhikkhū nimantesi
translated: But now he has invited the senior monks without informing me.

original: duṭṭhodānāyaṁ citto gahapati anapekkho virattarūpo mayī”ti cittaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: duṭṭhodāna ayam cittaḥ gahapati anapekkhaḥ viratta rūpaḥ mayi iti cittam gahapatim etat avoca
translated: He must be angry with me and has lost all respect and affection for me.” He said to Citta,

original: “alaṁ, gahapati, nādhivāsemī”ti.
analyzed: ala gahapati na adhivāsemi iti
translated: “That’s enough, I won’t be coming.”

original: Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi kho citto gahapati āyasmantaṁ sudhammaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho cittaḥ gahapati āyasmantam sudhammam etat avoca
translated: and a third time Citta said to Sudhamma,

original: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, ayyo sudhammo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ therehī”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhante ayyaḥ sudhammaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim therehi iti
translated: “Venerable Sudhamma, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”

original: “Alaṁ, gahapati, nādhivāsemī”ti.
analyzed: ala gahapati na adhivāsemi iti
translated: “There’s no need, householder. I won’t be able to come.”

original: Atha kho citto gahapati—
analyzed: atha khalu cittaḥ gahapati
translated: Citta thought,

original: “kiṁ me karissati ayyo sudhammo adhivāsento vā anadhivāsento vā”ti āyasmantaṁ sudhammaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: kim me karissati ayyaḥ sudhammaḥ adhivāsentaḥ vā an adhivāsentaḥ vā ati āyasmantam sudhammam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: “What does it matter to me whether he accepts or not?” He bowed down, circumambulated Sudhamma with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho citto gahapati tassā rattiyā accayena therānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpesi.
analyzed: atha kho cittaḥ gahapati tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena therānam bhikkhūnam paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpesi
translated: The following morning Citta had various kinds of fine food prepared.

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudhammo—🔽“yannūnāhaṁ cittassa gahapatino therānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ paṭiyattaṁ passeyyan”ti pubbaṇhasamayaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudhammaḥ  yat nūna aham cittassa gahapatino therānam bhikkhūnam paṭiyattam passeyyanti pubbaṇhasamaya
translated: Sudhamma thought,

original: nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena cittassa gahapatino nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena cittassa gahapatino nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: “Why don’t I go to see what Citta has prepared for the senior monks?” He then put on his sarong and upper robe, took his bowl and robe, and went to Citta’s house,

original: paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: paññatte āsane
translated: where he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho citto gahapati yenāyasmā sudhammo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sudhammaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho cittaḥ gahapati yena āyasmā sudhammo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam sudhammam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: He then went up to Sudhamma, bowed, and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cittaṁ gahapatiṁ āyasmā sudhammo etadavoca—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho cittam gahapatim āyasmā sudhammaḥ etat avoca
translated: Sudhamma said to him,

original: “pahūtaṁ kho te idaṁ, gahapati, khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyattaṁ;
analyzed: pahūtam kho te idam gahapati khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyatta
translated: “Householder, you’ve prepared plenty of food and drinks,

original: ekā ca kho idha natthi yadidaṁ tilasaṅguḷikā”ti.
analyzed: ekā ca kho idha na atthi yat idam tila saṅguḷikā ati
translated: but there’s no sesame or beans.”

original: “Bahumhi vata, bhante, ratane buddhavacane vijjamāne ayyena sudhammena yadeva kiñci bhāsitaṁ yadidaṁ tilasaṅguḷikāti.
analyzed: bahumhi vata bhante ratane buddha vacane vijjamāne ayyena sudhammena yat eva kiñci bhāsitam yat idam tila saṅguḷikā ati
translated: “Sir, there are many gems in the Buddha’s teaching,🔽but you say ‘sesame or beans’?

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhante, dakkhiṇāpathakā vāṇijā puratthimaṁ janapadaṁ agamaṁsu vāṇijjāya.
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhante dakkhiṇāpathakāḥ vāṇijāḥ puratthimam janapadam agamasu vāṇijjāya
translated: Once there were merchants from the southern country who went to the eastern country on trading business.

original: Te tato kukkuṭiṁ ānesuṁ.🔽Atha kho sā, bhante, kukkuṭī kākena saddhiṁ saṁvāsaṁ kappesi.
analyzed: te tatas kukkuṭim ānesu  atha kho sā bhante kukkuṭī kākena saddhim sa vāsam kappesi
translated: They brought back a hen.🔽She mated with a crow.

original: Sā potakaṁ janesi.
analyzed: sā potakam janesi
translated: She laid an egg,

original: Yadā kho so, bhante, kukkuṭapotako kākavassaṁ vassitukāmo hoti, kākakukkuṭīti vassati;
analyzed: yadā kho saḥ bhante kukkuṭa potakaḥ kāka vassam vassitu kāmaḥ hoti kāka kukkuṭī iti vassati
translated: When the chick wants to crow like a crow, it crows ‘caw, caw.’

original: yadā kukkuṭivassaṁ vassitukāmo hoti, kukkuṭikākāti vassati.
analyzed: yadā kukkuṭi vassam vassitu kāmaḥ hoti vassati
translated: When it wants to crow like a hen, it crows ‘kuk, kuk.’

original: Evameva kho, bhante, bahumhi ratane buddhavacane vijjamāne ayyena sudhammena yadeva kiñci bhāsitaṁ yadidaṁ tilasaṅguḷikā”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhante bahumhi ratane buddha vacane vijjamāne ayyena sudhammena yat eva kiñci bhāsitam yat idam tila saṅguḷikā ati
translated: In the same way, when there are so many teachings spoken by the Buddha, Venerable Sudhamma has spoken about sesame seeds and beans.”

original: “Akkosasi maṁ tvaṁ, gahapati, paribhāsasi maṁ tvaṁ, gahapati.
analyzed: akkosasi mam tva gahapati paribhāsasi mam tva gahapati
translated: “Householder, you’re insulting and abusing me.

original: Eso te, gahapati, āvāso, pakkamissāmī”ti.
analyzed: esaḥ te gahapati āvāsaḥ pakkamissāmi iti
translated: I’ll leave this monastery.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhante, ayyaṁ sudhammaṁ akkosāmi, paribhāsāmi.
analyzed: na aha bhante ayyam sudhammam akkosāmi paribhāsāmi
translated: “Venerable, I’m not insulting or abusing you.

original: Vasatu, bhante, ayyo sudhammo macchikāsaṇḍe.
analyzed: vasatu bhante ayyaḥ sudhammaḥ macchikāsaṇḍe
translated: Please stay in Macchikāsaṇḍa.

original: Ramaṇīyaṁ ambāṭakavanaṁ.
analyzed: ramaṇīyam ambāṭaka vana
translated: Ambāṭakavana is delightful.

original: Ahaṁ ayyassa sudhammassa ussukkaṁ karissāmi, cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānan”ti.
analyzed: aham ayyassa sudhammassa ussukkam karissāmi cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārān anti
translated: I’ll make sure you get robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies.”

original: Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi kho āyasmā sudhammo cittaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi khalu āyasmā sudhammaḥ cittam gahapatim etat avoca
translated: A third time Citta said to Sudhamma,

original: “akkosasi maṁ tvaṁ, gahapati, paribhāsasi maṁ tvaṁ, gahapati.
analyzed: akkosasi mam tva gahapati paribhāsasi mam tva gahapati
translated: “Householder, you’ve abused and insulted me.

original: Eso te, gahapati, āvāso, pakkamissāmī”ti.
analyzed: esaḥ te gahapati āvāsaḥ pakkamissāmi iti
translated: This is your monastery. I’m leaving.”

original: “Kahaṁ, bhante, ayyo sudhammo gamissatī”ti?
analyzed: kaha bhante ayyo sudhammo gamissati iti
translated: “Sir, where will you go?”

original: “Sāvatthiṁ kho ahaṁ, gahapati, gamissāmi bhagavantaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
analyzed: sāvatthim kho aha gahapati gamissāmi bhagavantam dassanāya ati
translated: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.”

original: “Tena hi, bhante, yañca attanā bhaṇitaṁ, yañca mayā bhaṇitaṁ taṁ sabbaṁ bhagavato ārocehi.
analyzed: tena hi bhante yat ca attanā yat ca mayā bhaṇitam tat sabbam bhagavataḥ ārocehi
translated: “Well then, please tell the Buddha all that I’ve said and what you’ve said.

original: Anacchariyaṁ kho panetaṁ, bhante, yaṁ ayyo sudhammo punadeva macchikāsaṇḍaṁ paccāgaccheyyā”ti.
analyzed: anacchariyam kho pana ita bhante yam ayyaḥ sudhammo punadeva macchikāsaṇḍam paccāgaccheyya ati
translated: It’s not surprising that you’ll come back to Macchikāsaṇḍa.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudhammo senāsanaṁ saṁsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudhammaḥ senāsanam sasāmetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi
translated: Sudhamma then put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and set out for Sāvatthī.

original: Anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṁ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanam anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery, bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā sudhammo yañca attanā bhaṇitaṁ yañca cittena gahapatinā bhaṇitaṁ taṁ sabbaṁ bhagavato ārocesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho āyasmā sudhammaḥ yat ca attanā bhaṇitam yat ca cittena gahapatinā bhaṇitam tam sabbam bhagavataḥ ārocesi
translated: and told the Buddha what had happened.

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Buddha rebuked him,

original: “ananucchavikaṁ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṁ appatirūpaṁ assāmaṇakaṁ akappiyaṁ akaraṇīyaṁ.
analyzed: ananucchavika moghapurisa ananulomikam appatirūpam a sāmaṇakam a kappiyam a karaṇīya
translated: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

original: Kathañhi nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, cittaṁ gahapatiṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ dāyakaṁ kārakaṁ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṁ hīnena khuṁsessasi, hīnena vambhessasi?🔽Netaṁ, moghapurisa, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: katham hi nāma tva mogha purisa cittam gahapatim saddham pasannam dāyakam kārakam saṅgha upaṭṭhākam hīnena khusessasi hīnena vambhessasi  neta moghapurisa appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: How could you, foolish man, reproach and insult the householder Citta, who has confidence and faith, who is a donor and a patron, who provides for the Sangha’s needs?

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: Foolish man, this neither inspires faith in the faithless …”

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Having rebuked him and given a teaching, he addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ karotu—
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam karotu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma, instructing him to get the householder Citta to forgive him.

original: citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti.
analyzed: cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti
translated: The householder Citta should be asked to forgive him.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: And, monks, it should be done like this:

original: paṭhamaṁ sudhammo bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṁ āropetabbo, āpattiṁ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: paṭhamam sudhammaḥ bhikkhu codetabbaḥ codetvā sāretabbaḥ sāretvā āpattim āropetabbaḥ āpattim āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: First Sudhamma should be told of the accusation. He should then be reminded of his actions, and the charge should be laid against him. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ sudhammo bhikkhu cittaṁ gahapatiṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ dāyakaṁ kārakaṁ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṁ hīnena khuṁseti, hīnena vambheti.
analyzed: ayam sudhammaḥ bhikkhu cittam gahapatim saddham pasannam dāyakam kārakam saṅgha upaṭṭhākam hīnena khuseti hīnena vambheti
translated: The monk Sudhamma has abused and insulted the faithful and confident householder Citta, a giver and supporter of the Sangha, by speaking inappropriately to him.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya—
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma,

original: citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti.
analyzed: cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti
translated: and he should ask Citta for forgiveness.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ sudhammo bhikkhu cittaṁ gahapatiṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ dāyakaṁ kārakaṁ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṁ hīnena khuṁseti, hīnena vambheti.
analyzed: ayam sudhammaḥ bhikkhu cittam gahapatim saddham pasannam dāyakam kārakam saṅgha upaṭṭhākam hīnena khuseti hīnena vambheti
translated: The monk Sudhamma has abused and insulted the faithful and confident householder Citta, a giver and supporter of the Sangha, by speaking inappropriately to him.

original: Saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma,🔽and he should ask Citta for forgiveness.

original: citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti.
analyzed: cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti
translated: Citta the householder should be forgiven.”

original: Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa karaṇa cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of this should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ sudhammo bhikkhu cittaṁ gahapatiṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ dāyakaṁ kārakaṁ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṁ hīnena khuṁseti, hīnena vambheti.
analyzed: ayam sudhammaḥ bhikkhu cittam gahapatim saddham pasannam dāyakam kārakam saṅgha upaṭṭhākam hīnena khuseti hīnena vambheti
translated: The monk Sudhamma has abused and insulted the faithful and confident householder Citta, a supporter of the Sangha.

original: Saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma,

original: citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti.
analyzed: cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti
translated: saying, ‘You should ask for forgiveness from the householder Citta.’

original: Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa karaṇa cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing this should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Kataṁ saṅghena sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ—
analyzed: katam saṅghena sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kamma
translated: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

original: citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti.
analyzed: cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti
translated: saying, ‘You should ask for forgiveness from the householder Citta.’

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’ti.🔽4.1. Adhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti  adhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’🔽. The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures that are legitimate-like

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: “When a procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Asammukhā kataṁ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: asammukhā katam hoti appaṭipucchā katam hoti appaṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of reconciliation has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.🔽Anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca  anāpattiyā katam hoti a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe
translated: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:🔽it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense. …

original: acodetvā kataṁ hoti, asāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a codetvā katam hoti a sāretvā katam hoti āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense. …

original: asammukhā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: asammukhā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done without questioning the accused, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: appaṭipucchā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  appaṭiññāya katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  anāpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done against one who is not an offender, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽acodetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽asāretvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  a codetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  a sāretvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done against one who has committed an offense that hasn’t been specified, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is illegitimate, it is done by an incomplete assembly—

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Paṭisāraṇīyakamme adhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya kamme adhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.

original: 4.2. Dhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: dhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: 13. The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Sammukhā kataṁ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: sammukhā katam hoti paṭipucchā katam hoti paṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with questioning, it’s done with admission.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of reconciliation has these three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:🔽it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense. …

original: Āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: āpattiyā katam hoti desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adesitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe
translated: “It’s done about an offense, but not about an offense that should be acknowledged; it’s done about an offense that hasn’t been acknowledged; …🔽…

original: codetvā kataṁ hoti, sāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽sammukhā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: codetvā katam hoti sāretvā katam hoti āpattim āropetvā katam hoti pe  sammukhā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done by charging, it is done by having admitted, it is done by having laid an accusation …🔽it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done face-to-face …

original: paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: paṭipucchā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  paṭiññāya katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done by questioning …🔽it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done by admission …🔽it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done by acting according to what has been admitted …

original: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽codetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  codetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done by resolution through recollection …🔽it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done by resolution because of past insanity …🔽it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done by charging …

original: sāretvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: sāretvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly, it is done by having admitted …

original: āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: āpattim āropetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: The one who’s accused has admitted to the offense.🔽The procedure is legitimate. The procedure is done by a unanimous assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam paṭisāraṇīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: When a procedure of reconciliation has these three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.

original: Paṭisāraṇīyakamme dhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya kamme dhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.

original: 4.3. Ākaṅkhamānacatukka
analyzed: ākaṅkhamāna catukka
translated: The group of four on wishing

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him:

original: Gihīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, gihīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, gihīnaṁ anāvāsāya parisakkati, gihī akkosati paribhāsati, gihī gihīhi bhedeti—
analyzed: gihīnam alābhāya parisakkati gihīnam anatthāya parisakkati gihīnam anāvāsāya parisakkati gihī akkosati paribhāsati gihī gihīhi bhedeti
translated: he’s trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; he’s trying to stop householders from acquiring merit; he’s trying to get householders to lose their support; he abuses and reviles householders; he causes division between householders.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.🔽Gihīnaṁ buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, gihīnaṁ dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, gihīnaṁ saṅghassa🔽avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, gihī hīnena khuṁseti hīnena vambheti, gihīnaṁ dhammikaṁ paṭissavaṁ na saccāpeti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.🔽Pañcannaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya  gihīnam buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati gihīnam dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati gihīnam saṅghassa  avaṇṇam bhāsati gihī hīnena khuseti hīnena vambheti gihīnam dhammikam paṭissavam na saccā apeti  imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhunaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya  pañcanna bhikkhave bhikkhūna ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him:

original: Eko gihīnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, eko gihīnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, eko gihīnaṁ anāvāsāya parisakkati, eko gihī akkosati paribhāsati, eko gihī gihīhi bhedeti—
analyzed: ekaḥ gihīnam alābhāya parisakkati ekaḥ gihīnam anatthāya parisakkati ekaḥ gihīnam anāvāsāya parisakkati ekaḥ gihī akkosati paribhāsati ekaḥ gihī gihīhi bhedeti
translated: he disparages lay people; he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha; he disparages the training; he criticizes the legal procedures; he criticizes the instructors in the training; he criticizes the expounders of the Teaching; he criticizes the Sangha; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the supporters of the Sangha; he criticizes the supporters of the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’s supporters; he criticizes the Sangha’

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave pañcannam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya
translated: When he feels like it, the Sangha can do a legal procedure of reconciliation against any of these five kinds of monks.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, pañcannaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.🔽Eko gihīnaṁ buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko gihīnaṁ dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave pañcannam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya  ekaḥ gihīnam buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ gihīnam dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ
translated: When he feels like it, the Sangha can also do a procedure of reconciliation against any of these five kinds of monks:

original: gihīnaṁ saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko gihī hīnena khuṁseti hīnena vambheti, eko🔽gihīnaṁ dhammikaṁ paṭissavaṁ na saccāpeti—
analyzed: gihīnam saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ gihī hīnena khuseti hīnena vambheti ekaḥ  gihīnam dhammikam paṭissavam na saccā apeti
translated: one who disparages the Buddha to householders, one who disparages the Teaching to householders, one who disparages the Sangha to householders, one who abuses and reviles householders, and one who doesn’t consent to a legitimate legal procedure.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kareyya.🔽Ākaṅkhamānacatukkaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave pañcannam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ paṭisāraṇīya kammam kareyya  ākaṅkhamāna catukkam niṭṭhita
translated: When he feels like it, the Sangha can do a procedure of reconciliation against any of these five kinds of monks.”🔽The group of four on “when he feels like it” is finished.

original: 4.4. Aṭṭhārasavatta
analyzed: aṭṭhārasavatta
translated: . The eighteen kinds of conduct

original: Paṭisāraṇīyakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya kamma katena bhikkhave bhikkhunā sammā
translated: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself should conduct himself properly.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—🔽na upasampādetabbaṁ,🔽na nissayo dātabbo,
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā  na upasampādetabba  na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: This is the proper conduct:🔽He shouldn’t give the full ordination.🔽He shouldn’t give formal support.

original: na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo,
analyzed: na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

original: na bhikkhunovādakasammuti sāditabbā,
analyzed: na bhikkhunā uvādaka sammuti sāditabbā
translated: You shouldn’t consent to being a tutor of nuns.

original: sammatenapi bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā.🔽Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
analyzed: sammatena api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovaditabbā  yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kammam katam hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā
translated: Even if you’re consented to, you shouldn’t tutor the nuns.🔽You shouldn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the legal procedure of reconciliation against you.

original: aññā vā tādisikā,
analyzed: aññā vā tādisikā
translated: You shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against you.

original: tato vā pāpiṭṭhatarā;🔽kammaṁ na garahitabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatarā  kammam na
translated: You shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against you.🔽You shouldn’t criticize the procedure.

original: kammikā na garahitabbā.🔽Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatho ṭhapetabbo,
analyzed: kammikā na garahitabbā  na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaḥ ṭhapetabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.🔽You shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.🔽You shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

original: na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā,🔽na savacanīyaṁ kātabbaṁ,
analyzed: na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā  na savacanīyam
translated: You shouldn’t do a legal procedure against a regular monk.🔽You shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

original: na anuvādo paṭṭhapetabbo,🔽na okāso kāretabbo,🔽na codetabbo,
analyzed: na anuvādaḥ paṭṭhapetabbo  na okāsaḥ kāretabbo  na codetabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.🔽You shouldn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.🔽You shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

original: na sāretabbo,
analyzed: na sāretabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t press him on the details.

original: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabban”ti.
analyzed: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti
translated: You shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

original: Paṭisāraṇīyakamme aṭṭhārasavattaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya kamme aṭṭhārasa vattam niṭṭhita
translated: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of reconciliation are finished.

original: Atha kho saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ akāsi—
analyzed: atha kho saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam akāsi
translated: The Sangha did a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

original: “citto te gahapati khamāpetabbo”ti.
analyzed: cittaḥ te gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ iti
translated: saying, “You should ask for forgiveness from the householder Citta.”

original: So saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato macchikāsaṇḍaṁ gantvā maṅkubhūto nāsakkhi cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpetuṁ.
analyzed: saḥ saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kamma kataḥ macchikāsaṇḍam gantvā maṅku bhūtaḥ na asakkhi cittam gahapatim khamāpetu
translated: After the Sangha had done a legal procedure of reconciliation against him, he went to Macchikāsaṇḍa, but he was so miserable that he was unable to ask for forgiveness from the householder Citta.

original: Punadeva sāvatthiṁ paccāgañchi.🔽Bhikkhū evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: punar eva sāvatthim paccāgañchi  bhikkhū evam āhasu
translated: He returned to Sāvatthī.

original: “khamāpito tayā, āvuso sudhamma, citto gahapatī”ti?
analyzed: khamāpitaḥ tayā āvuso sudhamma cittaḥ gahapati iti
translated: The monks asked him, “Did you get Citta to forgive Sudhamma?”

original: “Idhāhaṁ, āvuso, macchikāsaṇḍaṁ gantvā maṅkubhūto nāsakkhiṁ cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpetun”ti.
analyzed: idha aha āvuso macchikāsaṇḍam gantvā maṅku bhūtaḥ na asakkhim cittam gahapatim khamāpetunti
translated: “I went to Macchikāsaṇḍa, but I was so embarrassed that I couldn’t get him to forgive Sudhamma.”

original: Bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe….
analyzed: bhikkhū bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: The monks told the Buddha. …

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtaṁ detu—
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhunaḥ anudūtam detu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should give Sudhamma a companion messenger

original: cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpetuṁ.
analyzed: cittam gahapatim khamāpetu
translated: to get Citta to forgive him.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, dātabbo—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave dātabbaḥ
translated: And he should be given like this.

original: paṭhamaṁ bhikkhu yācitabbo, yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: paṭhamam bhikkhu yācitabbaḥ yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: First you should ask a monk, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmaṁ bhikkhuṁ sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtaṁ dadeyya cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpetuṁ.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ itthannāmam bhikkhum sudhammassa bhikkhunaḥ anudūtam dadeyya cittam gahapatim khamāpetu
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give monk so-and-so as a companion messenger to Sudhamma to get Citta to forgive him.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmaṁ bhikkhuṁ sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtaṁ deti cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpetuṁ.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmam bhikkhum sudhammassa bhikkhunaḥ anudūtam deti cittam gahapatim khamāpetu
translated: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as the messenger monk to ask Citta for forgiveness.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtassa dānaṁ cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpetuṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtassa dānam cittam gahapatim khamāpetu saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as the messenger monk to ask Citta for forgiveness should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmo bhikkhu sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūto cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpetuṁ.
analyzed: dinnaḥ saṅghena itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtaḥ cittam gahapatim khamāpetu
translated: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as the messenger monk to ask Citta for forgiveness.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

original: Tena, bhikkhave, sudhammena bhikkhunā anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ macchikāsaṇḍaṁ gantvā citto gahapati khamāpetabbo—🔽‘khama, gahapati, pasādemi tan’ti.
analyzed: tena bhikkhave sudhammena bhikkhunā anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhim macchikāsaṇḍam gantvā cittaḥ gahapati khamāpetabbaḥ  khama gahapati pasādemi tanti
translated: “The messenger monk should then go to Macchikāsaṇḍa together with the monk Sudhamma and ask Citta for forgiveness,

original: Evañce vuccamāno khamati, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ.
analyzed: evañce vuccamānaḥ khamati id ca itam kusala
translated: saying, ‘Please forgive him, householder, and I’ll get him to be at peace with you.’🔽If Citta forgives him, all is well.

original: No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbo—
analyzed: no ce khamati anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbaḥ
translated: If not, the messenger monk should say,

original: ‘khama, gahapati, imassa bhikkhuno, pasādeti tan’ti.
analyzed: khama gahapati imassa bhikkhuno pasādeti tanti
translated: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder, and I’ll get him to be at peace with you.’

original: Evañce vuccamāno khamati, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ.
analyzed: evañce vuccamānaḥ khamati id ca itam kusala
translated: If he agrees, all is well.

original: No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbo—
analyzed: no ce khamati anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbaḥ
translated: If he doesn’t agree, a monk who has a following should say to him,

original: ‘khama, gahapati, imassa bhikkhuno, ahaṁ taṁ pasādemī’ti.
analyzed: khama gahapati imassa bhikkhuno aham tam pasādemi iti
translated: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder. I’ll make you see things as they really are.’

original: Evañce vuccamāno khamati, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ.
analyzed: evañce vuccamānaḥ khamati id ca itam kusala
translated: If he agrees, all is well.

original: No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbo—
analyzed: no ce khamati anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbaḥ
translated: If he doesn’t agree, a monk who has a following should say to him,

original: ‘khama, gahapati, imassa bhikkhuno, saṅghassa vacanenā’ti.
analyzed: khama gahapati imassa bhikkhuno saṅghassa vacanena ati
translated: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder, on the advice of the Sangha.’

original: Evañce vuccamāno khamati, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ.🔽No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā sudhammo bhikkhu cittassa gahapatino dassanūpacāraṁ
analyzed: evañce vuccamānaḥ khamati id ca itam kusala  no ce khamati anudūtena bhikkhunā sudhammaḥ bhikkhu cittassa gahapatino
translated: If he agrees, all is well.🔽If he doesn’t agree, a monk who has a following should say to him,🔽‘Please don’t have Sudhamma go beyond the range of your sight or hearing.

original: avijahāpetvā savanūpacāraṁ avijahāpetvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ kārāpetvā ukkuṭikaṁ
analyzed: a vijahāpetvā savanūpacāram a vijahāpetvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam kārāpetvā ukkuṭika
translated: Have him put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels,

original: nisīdāpetvā añjaliṁ paggaṇhāpetvā taṁ āpattiṁ desāpetabbo”ti.
analyzed: nisīdāpetvā añjalim paggaṇhāpetvā tam āpattim desāpetabbaḥ ti
translated: and raise his joined palms. Then make him confess that offense.’”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sudhammo anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ macchikāsaṇḍaṁ gantvā cittaṁ gahapatiṁ khamāpesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sudhammaḥ anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhim macchikāsaṇḍam gantvā cittam gahapatim khamāpesi
translated: Sudhamma went to Macchikāsaṇḍa with a monk who had a following and asked for Citta’s forgiveness.

original: So sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: so sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evam vadeti
translated: He then conducts himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and he asks the monks for forgiveness, saying,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi.
analyzed: aha āvuso saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kamma kato sammā vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi
translated: “Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against me, but I’ve conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released.

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: What should I do now?”

original: Bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: bhikkhū bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: The monks told the Buddha. Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetu.🔽4.5. Nappaṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasaka
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambhetu  na paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasaka
translated: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma.🔽… The group of eighteen on not to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted:🔽he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

original: Upasampādeti, nissayaṁ deti, sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
analyzed: upasampādeti nissayam deti sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadati
translated: Ordains, gives the full admission, gives formal support, looks after a novice monk, consents to being the instructor of the nuns, and instructs the nuns, whether agreed upon or not.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam  yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: kammaṁ garahati, kammike garahati—
analyzed: kammam garahati kammike garahati
translated: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṁ karoti, anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṁ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti pavāraṇam ṭhapeti savacanīyam karoti anuvādam paṭṭhapeti okāsam kāreti codeti sāreti bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: If a monk who’s committed an offense gives the observance-day ceremony, gives the invitation ceremony, does the observance-day ceremony, does the invitation ceremony, does a legal procedure, proposes a legal procedure, makes a legal declaration, accuses, reminds, or has a conversation with other monks,🔽then the process of reconciliation for that monk shouldn’t be lifted.🔽The group of eighteen on the process of reconciliation that shouldn’t be lifted is finished.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Paṭisāraṇīyakamme nappaṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽4.6. Paṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasaka🔽Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṁ deti, na sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba  paṭisāraṇīya kamme na paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasakam niṭṭhita  paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasaka  pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba  na upasampādeti na nissayam deti na sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti na bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovadati
translated: 1.18 The group of eighteen on lifting🔽“When a monk has five qualities, the process of reconciliation against him should be lifted:

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t accept a novice monk; he doesn’t accept a trainee nun for the training; he doesn’t accept a regular monk’s bowl or robe; he doesn’t participate in invitations; he doesn’t participate in legal procedures; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues; he doesn’t speak to other monks in private about legal issues

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañcah aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ na āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim na āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;

original: kammaṁ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
analyzed: kammam na garahati kammike na garahati
translated: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṁ karoti, na anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṁ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti na pavāraṇam ṭhapeti na savacanīyam karoti na anuvādam paṭṭhapeti na okāsam kāreti na codeti na sāreti na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t get a regular monk to direct; he doesn’t approve of a regular monk; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted.

original: Paṭisāraṇīyakamme paṭippassambhetabbaaṭṭhārasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya kamme paṭippassambhetabba aṭṭhārasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of eighteen on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of reconciliation is finished.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: And it should be lifted like this.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, sudhammena bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ
analyzed: tena bhikkhave sudhammena bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅga
translated: The monk Sudhamma should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: karitvā vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: karitvā vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: bow down at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: aha bhante saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kamma kato sammā vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against me. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ sudhammo bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam sudhammaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kamma kato sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Sudhamma, who’s had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself, is now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that procedure to be lifted.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambheyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift that procedure of reconciliation against him.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ sudhammo bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam sudhammaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kamma kato sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Sudhamma, who’s had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself, is now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that procedure to be lifted.

original: Saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambheti  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: The Sangha lifts that procedure of reconciliation against him.🔽Any monk who approves of lifting that procedure of reconciliation should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.🔽Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya  dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.🔽For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Please listen, Venerables.

original: Ayaṁ sudhammo bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam sudhammaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīya kamma kato sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Sudhamma, who had a procedure of reconciliation imposed on him by the Sangha, is now conducting himself properly and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that procedure to be lifted.

original: Saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha lifts that procedure of reconciliation.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of lifting that procedure of reconciliation should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Paṭippassaddhaṁ saṅghena sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ.
analyzed: paṭippassaddham saṅghena sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīya kamma
translated: The Sangha has lifted that procedure of reconciliation for the monk Sudhamma.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.🔽Paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti  paṭisāraṇīya kammam niṭṭhitam catuttha
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”🔽The fourth section on the procedure of reconciliation is finished.

original: 5. Āpattiyāadassaneukkhepanīyakamma
analyzed: āpattiyā a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma
translated: The legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā kosambiyam viharati ghosita ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ passituṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channaḥ āpattim āpajjitvā na icchati āpattim passitu
translated: At that time Venerable Channa had committed an offense but refused to recognize it.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

original: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṁ passitun”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma āyasmā channaḥ āpattim āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattim passitunti
translated: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense but refuse to recognize it?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ passitun”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā na icchati āpattim passitunti
translated: “Is it true, Channa, that you’re doing this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—🔽“ananucchavikaṁ …pe…🔽kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṁ passituṁ?
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān  an anucchavikam pe  katham hi nāma saḥ bhikkhave mogha purisaḥ āpattim āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattim passitu
translated: The Buddha rebuked him,🔽“It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

original: Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: How can you commit an offense but refuse to recognize it?🔽This won’t encourage confidence in those without it …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking him …🔽he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: and addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ karotu—
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam karotu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: He’s not to have any interaction with the Sangha.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: And, monks, it should be done like this.

original: paṭhamaṁ channo bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṁ āropetabbo, āpattiṁ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: paṭhamam channaḥ bhikkhu codetabbaḥ codetvā sāretabbaḥ sāretvā āpattim āropetabbaḥ āpattim āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: First you should accuse the monk Channa. He should then be reminded of the accusation, charged with an offense, and a competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ passituṁ.
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā na icchati āpattim passitu
translated: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but he refuses to recognize it.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya—
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: He’s not to have any interaction with the Sangha.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ passituṁ.
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā na icchati āpattim passitu
translated: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but he refuses to recognize it.

original: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇa
translated: He’s not to take part in the Sangha’s business.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha, should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.🔽Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya  dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.🔽For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.🔽Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ passituṁ.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ  ayam channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā na icchati āpattim passitu
translated: Venerables, listen to me.🔽The monk Channa has committed an offense, but he refuses to recognize it.

original: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇa
translated: He’s not to take part in the Sangha’s business.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha, should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.🔽The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: Kataṁ saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ—
analyzed: katam saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma
translated: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: He’s not to take part in the Sangha’s business.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’

original: Āvāsaparamparañca, bhikkhave, saṁsatha—
analyzed: āvāsa paramparam ca bhikkhave sasatha
translated: And pass on the information about the monastery.

original: ‘channo bhikkhu saṅghena āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato—
analyzed: channaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ
translated: ‘The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghenā’ti.🔽5.1. Adhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena ati  adhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: He’s not to take part in the Sangha’s business.’🔽. The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures concerning not recognizing an offense

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Asammukhā kataṁ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: asammukhā katam hoti appaṭipucchā katam hoti appaṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.🔽When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
