analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: . When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: When a procedure of ejecting someone for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽acodetvā kataṁ hoti, asāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽asammukhā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: anāpattiyā katam hoti a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe  a codetvā katam hoti a sāretvā katam hoti āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti pe  asammukhā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done about one who hasn’t committed an offense; it’s done about one who hasn’t committed an offense that’s clearable by confession; it’s done about one who’s confessed the offense. …🔽it’s done without having accused the person of their offense; it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense; it’s done without having charged the person with their offense. …🔽it’s done in the absence of the accused; it’s done illegitimately; it’s done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it’s done without questioning the accused; it’s done illegitimately; it’s done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: appaṭipucchā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  appaṭiññāya katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  anāpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done without the admission of the accused; it’s done illegitimately; it’s done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it’s done about one who hasn’t committed an offense; it’s done illegitimately; it’s done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done about one who hasn’t committed an offense that’s clearable by confession; it’s done illegitimately; it’s done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽acodetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽asāretvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  a codetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  a sāretvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: “The legal procedure has been done against one who has admitted an offense, but it’s illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽“The legal procedure has been done against one who hasn’t admitted an offense, but it’s illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti
translated: “The legal procedure has been done without having accused the person of their offense, but it’s illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽“The legal procedure has been done without having charged the person with their offense, but it’s illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly.”

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: “When a procedure of ejecting for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakamme adhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamme adhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The sub-chapter on illegitimate legal procedures of ejecting for not recognizing an offense is finished.

original: 5.2. Dhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: dhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: . The sub-chapter on legitimate legal procedures

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam dhamma kammam ca hoti vinaya kammam ca su vūpasantam ca
translated: “When a procedure of ejecting for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Sammukhā kataṁ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: sammukhā katam hoti paṭipucchā katam hoti paṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantañca
translated: When a legal procedure of ejecting someone for not recognizing an offense has these three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ …pe….
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatam pe
translated: When a procedure of ejecting someone for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.🔽It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.🔽It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.

original: Āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽codetvā kataṁ hoti, sāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽sammukhā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: āpattiyā katam hoti desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adesitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe  codetvā katam hoti sāretvā katam hoti āpattim āropetvā katam hoti pe  sammukhā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.🔽It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.🔽It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.

original: paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: paṭipucchā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  paṭiññāya katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.🔽It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.

original: āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: It’s done legitimately, in accordance with the rule.

original: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  a desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: “The offense that’s the basis for the reproving has been committed, it’s been properly reproved, it’s been done by a unanimous assembly. …

original: codetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: codetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: “The offense that’s the basis for the reproving hasn’t been confessed, it’s been properly reproved, it’s been done by a unanimous assembly. …🔽“The monk has been accused, it’s been properly reproved, it’s been done by a unanimous assembly. …

original: sāretvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: sāretvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  āpattim āropetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: “The monk has consented, it’s been properly reproved, it’s been done by a unanimous assembly. …🔽“The offense has been laid down, it’s been properly reproved, it’s been done by a unanimous assembly.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantañca
translated: When a legal procedure of ejecting for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakamme dhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamme dhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

original: 5.3. Ākaṅkhamānachakka
analyzed: ākaṅkhamāna chakka
translated: The group of six on wishing

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:

original: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;🔽bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ vivāda kārakaḥ bhassa kārako saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakaḥ  bālaḥ hoti a byattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ an apadānaḥ
translated: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

original: gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi—
analyzed: gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: he’s ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, lacking in boundaries;🔽he associates inappropriately with householders.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has three other qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:

original: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
analyzed: adhi sīle sīla vipannaḥ hoti ajjhācāre ācāra vipannaḥ hoti ati diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhi vipannaḥ hoti
translated: he’s failed in the higher morality; he’s failed in conduct; he’s failed in view.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

original: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: He disparages the Buddha, disparages the Teaching, and disparages the Sangha.🔽When a monk has these three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

original: Tiṇṇaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: tiṇṇa bhikkhave bhikkhūna ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting a monk for not recognizing an offense if three monks request it.

original: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
analyzed: ekaḥ bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ vivāda kārakaḥ bhassa kārako saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakaḥ
translated: One who is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

original: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: ekaḥ bālaḥ hoti abyattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ an apadānaḥ
translated: one who is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, lacking in boundaries;

original: eko gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi—
analyzed: ekaḥ gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: He associates inappropriately with householders.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it may, in regard to these three kinds of monks, do a legal procedure of ejecting them for not recognizing an offense.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it may, in regard to these three kinds of monks, do a legal procedure of ejecting them for not recognizing an offense.

original: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ adhi sīle sīla vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ajjhācāre ācāra vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ati diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhi vipannaḥ hoti
translated: One is deficient in the higher morality. One is deficient in conduct. One is deficient in view.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it may, in regard to these three kinds of monks, do a legal procedure of ejecting them for not recognizing an offense.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wants to, it may, in regard to these three kinds of monks, do a legal procedure of ejecting them for not recognizing an offense.

original: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—
analyzed: ekaḥ buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: One disparages the Buddha. One disparages the Teaching. One disparages the Sangha.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: When requested, the Sangha may, in accordance with the rule, do a procedure of ejecting a monk for not recognizing an offense.

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakamme ākaṅkhamānachakkaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽5.4. Tecattālīsavatta
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamme ākaṅkhamāna chakkam niṭṭhita  tecattālīsavatta
translated: The group of six on “when requested” in the case of a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.🔽… thirty-seven kinds of conduct

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma katena bhikkhave bhikkhunā sammā
translated: A monk who’s had a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense done against himself should conduct himself properly.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—🔽na upasampādetabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā  na upasampādetabba
translated: This is the proper conduct:🔽he shouldn’t give the full ordination,

original: na nissayo dātabbo,🔽na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo,
analyzed: na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ  na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t give formal support,🔽he shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him,

original: na bhikkhunovādakasammuti sāditabbā,
analyzed: na bhikkhunā uvādaka sammuti sāditabbā
translated: he shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns,

original: sammatenapi bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā.🔽Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,🔽aññā vā tādisikā,
analyzed: sammatena api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovaditabbā  yāya āpattiyā saṅghena āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam katam hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā  aññā vā tādisikā
translated: and he shouldn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.🔽He shouldn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.🔽He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

original: tato vā pāpiṭṭhatarā;🔽kammaṁ na garahitabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatarā  kammam na
translated: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.🔽He shouldn’t criticize the procedure.

original: kammikā na garahitabbā.
analyzed: kammikā na garahitabbā
translated: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.🔽He shouldn’t bow down to, stand up to greet, or raise his joined palms to a regular monk;

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṁ,🔽paccuṭṭhānaṁ,
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādana  paccuṭṭhāna
translated: he shouldn’t invite a regular monk to act as his preceptor;

original: añjalikammaṁ,
analyzed: añjali kamma
translated: he shouldn’t accept being appointed as a mentor monk;

original: sāmīcikammaṁ,🔽āsanābhihāro,
analyzed: sāmīcikamma  āsana abhihāraḥ
translated: He should not be made to do chores.

original: seyyābhihāro,🔽pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ,🔽pādakathalikaṁ,
analyzed: seyya abhihāro  pāda udakam pāda pīṭha  pāda kathalika
translated: He should not be made to prepare seats.🔽He should not be made to prepare beds.🔽He should not be made to prepare water for washing the feet or a foot stool.

original: pattacīvarappaṭiggahaṇaṁ,
analyzed: patta cīvara paṭiggahaṇa
translated: He should not be made to prepare a foot scraper.🔽He should not be made to receive bowls and robes.

original: nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṁ sāditabbaṁ.🔽Na pakatatto bhikkhu sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṁsetabbo,
analyzed: nahāne piṭṭhi parikammam  na pakatattaḥ bhikkhu sīla vipattiyā an uddhasetabbaḥ
translated: He should not be made to massage the back when bathing.🔽He should not be accused of failure in morality.

original: na ācāravipattiyā anuddhaṁsetabbo,
analyzed: na ācāra vipattiyāḥ an uddhasetabbaḥ
translated: He should not be accused of failure in conduct.

original: na diṭṭhivipattiyā anuddhaṁsetabbo,
analyzed: na diṭṭhi vipattiyā an uddhasetabbaḥ
translated: He should not be accused of failure in view.

original: na ājīvavipattiyā anuddhaṁsetabbo,🔽na bhikkhu bhikkhūhi bhedetabbo,
analyzed: na ājīva vipattiyāḥ an uddhasetabbaḥ  na bhikkhu bhikkhūhi bhedetabbaḥ
translated: He should not be accused of failure in livelihood.🔽He should not be accused of schism in the Sangha.

original: na gihiddhajo dhāretabbo,🔽na titthiyaddhajo dhāretabbo,
analyzed: na gihiddhajaḥ dhāretabbaḥ  na titthiyaddhajaḥ dhāretabbo
translated: He should not wear lay clothes.🔽He should not wear the robes of the monastics of other religions.

original: na titthiyā sevitabbā;🔽bhikkhū sevitabbā,
analyzed: na titthiyā sevitabbā  bhikkhū sevitabbā
translated: He should not associate with the monastics of other religions.🔽He should associate with monks.

original: bhikkhusikkhāya sikkhitabbaṁ.🔽Na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ ekacchanne āvāse vatthabbaṁ,
analyzed: bhikkhu sikkhāya  na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhim ekacchanne āvāse
translated: He should train in the monks’ training.🔽He should not stay in an inhabited area in the same room as a regular monk.

original: na ekacchanne anāvāse vatthabbaṁ,
analyzed: na eka channe anāvāse
translated: He should not stay in an uninhabited area in the same room as a regular monk.

original: na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vatthabbaṁ,
analyzed: na eka channe āvāse vā anāvāse vā
translated: He should not stay in an inhabited area or an uninhabited area in the same room as a regular monk.

original: pakatattaṁ bhikkhuṁ disvā āsanā vuṭṭhātabbaṁ,
analyzed: pakatattam bhikkhum disvā āsanā vuṭṭhātabba
translated: When he sees a regular monk, he should get up from his seat.

original: na pakatatto bhikkhu āsādetabbo anto vā bahi vā.
analyzed: na pakatattaḥ bhikkhu āsādetabbaḥ antar vā bahi vā
translated: He should not invite a regular monk to any house, whether inside or outside the monastery.”

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatho ṭhapetabbo,
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaḥ ṭhapetabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.🔽You shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

original: na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā,🔽na savacanīyaṁ kātabbaṁ,🔽na anuvādo paṭṭhapetabbo,
analyzed: na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā  na savacanīyam  na anuvādaḥ paṭṭhapetabbo
translated: You shouldn’t do a legal procedure with a regular monk.🔽You shouldn’t direct a regular monk to do a legal procedure.

original: na okāso kāretabbo,🔽na codetabbo,
analyzed: na okāsaḥ kāretabbo  na codetabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t ask a regular monk for permission to do a legal procedure.🔽You shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

original: na sāretabbo,
analyzed: na sāretabbaḥ
translated: You shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

original: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabban”ti.
analyzed: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti
translated: You shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakamme tecattālīsavattaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamme tecattālīsa vattam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of forty-three on not recognizing an offense is finished.

original: Atha kho saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ akāsi—
analyzed: atha kho saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam akāsi
translated: The Sangha did a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: making him stay apart from the Sangha.

original: So saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato tamhā āvāsā aññaṁ āvāsaṁ agamāsi.
analyzed: saḥ saṅghena āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ tamhā āvāsā aññam āvāsam agamāsi
translated: After the procedure, he went from that monastery to another.

original: Tattha bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṁ, na paccuṭṭhesuṁ, na añjalikammaṁ na sāmīcikammaṁ akaṁsu, na sakkariṁsu, na garuṁ kariṁsu, na mānesuṁ, na pūjesuṁ.
analyzed: tattha bhikkhū na iva abhivādesu na paccuṭṭhesu na añjali kammam na sāmīci kammam na na garum karisu na mānesu na pūjesu
translated: There too the monks neither bowed down to him, nor stood up to greet him, nor raised their joined palms to him, nor did acts of respect toward him. They did not do what was agreeable to him, but did what was disagreeable. They did not honor him, but dishonored him. They did not respect him, but disrespected him.

original: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato tamhāpi āvāsā aññaṁ āvāsaṁ agamāsi.🔽Tatthapi bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṁ, na paccuṭṭhesuṁ, na añjalikammaṁ na sāmīcikammaṁ akaṁsu, na sakkariṁsu, na garuṁ kariṁsu, na mānesuṁ, na pūjesuṁ.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhūhi a sakkariyamānaḥ a garukariyamānaḥ a māniyamānaḥ a pūjiyamānaḥ a sakkāra pakato tamhā api āvāsā aññam āvāsam agamāsi  tattha api bhikkhū na iva abhivādesu na paccuṭṭhesu na añjali kammam na sāmīci kammam na na sakkarisu na garum karisu na mānesu na pūjesu
translated: He went to another monastery,

original: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato tamhāpi āvāsā aññaṁ āvāsaṁ agamāsi.
analyzed: saḥ bhikkhūhi a sakkariyamānaḥ a garukariyamānaḥ a māniyamānaḥ a pūjiyamānaḥ a sakkāra pakato tamhā api āvāsā aññam āvāsam agamāsi
translated: but the monks there did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him.🔽He went to another monastery,

original: Tatthapi bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṁ, na paccuṭṭhesuṁ, na añjalikammaṁ na sāmīcikammaṁ akaṁsu, na sakkariṁsu, na garuṁ kariṁsu, na mānesuṁ, na pūjesuṁ.🔽So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato punadeva kosambiṁ paccāgañchi.
analyzed: tattha api bhikkhū na iva abhivādesu na paccuṭṭhesu na añjali kammam na sāmīci kammam na na sakkarisu na garum karisu na mānesu na pūjesu 🔽saḥ bhikkhūhi a sakkariyamānaḥ a garukariyamānaḥ a māniyamānaḥ a pūjiyamānaḥ a sakkāra pakataḥ punadeva kosambim paccāgañchi
translated: but the monks there also did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him.🔽He went back to Kosambī.

original: So sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadeti—
analyzed: so sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evam vadeti
translated: He then conducts himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and he asks the monks for forgiveness, saying,

original: “ahaṁ, āvuso, saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi.
analyzed: aha āvuso saṅghena āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma kato sammā vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi
translated: “Venerables, I’ve been given the trial period of six days for not recognizing an offense. I’ve conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and I ask the monks for forgiveness.”

original: Kathaṁ nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham nu kho mayā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: “What should I do now?”

original: Bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe….
analyzed: bhikkhū bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: The monks told the Buddha. …

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetu.🔽5.5. Nappaṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsaka
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetu  na ppaṭippassambhetabba te cattālīsaka
translated: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against the monk Channa. …🔽The group of forty-three on not to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against him shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Upasampādeti, nissayaṁ deti, sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
analyzed: upasampādeti nissayam deti sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadati
translated: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:🔽he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense;

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense;

original: kammaṁ garahati, kammike garahati—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: kammam garahati kammike garahati  imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: he disparages the procedure; he disparages those who did the procedure.🔽When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṁ, paccuṭṭhānaṁ, añjalikammaṁ, sāmīcikammaṁ, āsanābhihāraṁ sādiyati—
analyzed: pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādana paccuṭṭhāna añjalikamma sāmīcikamma āsana abhihāram sādiyati
translated: He consents to a regular monk bowing down to him, standing up for him, raising his joined palms to him, doing acts of respect toward him, and offering him a seat.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyābhihāraṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ, pādakathalikaṁ, pattacīvarappaṭiggahaṇaṁ, nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṁ sādiyati—
analyzed: pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyā abhihāra pāda udakam pāda pīṭha pāda kathalika patta cīvara paṭiggahaṇa nahāne piṭṭhi parikammam sādiyati
translated: He consents to a regular monk offering him a bed, a stool, water for washing his feet and a foot stool, a foot scraper, receiving his bowl and robe, and massaging his back when bathing.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pakatattaṁ bhikkhuṁ sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, ācāravipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, diṭṭhivipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, ājīvavipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, bhikkhuṁ bhikkhūhi bhedeti—
analyzed: pakatattam bhikkhum sīla vipattiyā anuddhaseti ācāra vipattiyā anuddhaseti diṭṭhi vipattiyā anuddhaseti ājīva vipattiyā anuddhaseti bhikkhum bhikkhūhi bhedeti
translated: he presses a monk who’s acting according to the rules to confess an offense; he presses a monk who’s not conducting himself properly to confess an offense; he presses a monk who’s got the wrong view to confess an offense; he presses a monk who’s got the wrong livelihood to confess an offense; he causes division between monks.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Gihiddhajaṁ dhāreti, titthiyaddhajaṁ dhāreti, titthiye sevati;
analyzed: gihiddhajam dhāra iti titthiyaddhajam dhāra iti titthiye sevati
translated: he wears lay clothes; he wears the robes of the monastics of other religions; he associates with the monastics of other religions;

original: bhikkhū na sevati, bhikkhusikkhāya na sikkhati—
analyzed: bhikkhū na sevati bhikkhu sikkhāya na sikkhati
translated: he doesn’t associate with monks; he doesn’t train in the monks’ training.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:🔽he stays in the same room as a regular monk;

original: Pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ ekacchanne āvāse vasati, ekacchanne anāvāse vasati, ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati;
analyzed: pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhim eka channe āvāse vasati eka channe anāvāse vasati eka channe āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati
translated: he stays in the same building as a regular monk;🔽he stays in the same compound as a regular monk;

original: pakatattaṁ bhikkhuṁ disvā āsanā na vuṭṭhāti;
analyzed: pakatattam bhikkhum disvā āsanā na vuṭṭhāti
translated: he doesn’t get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk;

original: pakatattaṁ bhikkhuṁ āsādeti anto vā bahi vā—
analyzed: pakatattam bhikkhum āsādeti antar vā bahi vā
translated: he invites a regular monk to commit one of the four offenses entailing immediate expulsion.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṁ karoti, anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṁ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti pavāraṇam ṭhapeti savacanīyam karoti anuvādam paṭṭhapeti okāsam kāreti codeti sāreti bhikkhūhi sampayojeti  imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: If a monk who’s committed an offense gives the observance-day ceremony, gives the invitation ceremony, does the observance-day ceremony, does the invitation ceremony, does a legal procedure, proposes a legal procedure, makes a legal declaration, accuses, reminds, or has a conversation with other monks,

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakamme nappaṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽5.6. Paṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsaka
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamme na paṭippassambhetabba tecattālīsakam niṭṭhita
translated: then a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted.🔽The group of forty-three on not to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.🔽. The group of forty-three on to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṁ deti, na sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
analyzed: na upasampādeti na nissayam deti na sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti na bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovadati
translated: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t accept a novice monk; he doesn’t accept a pupil; he doesn’t consent to a monk instructing the nuns; and even if he’s appointed, he doesn’t instruct the nuns.”🔽“When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ na āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam  yāya āpattiyā saṅghena āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim na āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: kammaṁ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
analyzed: kammam na garahati kammike na garahati
translated: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṁ, paccuṭṭhānaṁ, añjalikammaṁ, sāmīcikammaṁ, āsanābhihāraṁ sādiyati—
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādana paccuṭṭhāna añjalikamma sāmīcikamma āsana abhihāram sādiyati
translated: He doesn’t consent to a regular monk bowing down to him, standing up for him, raising his joined palms to him, doing acts of respect toward him, or offering him a seat.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted.

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyābhihāraṁ, pādodakaṁ pādapīṭhaṁ, pādakathalikaṁ, pattacīvarappaṭiggahaṇaṁ, nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṁ sādiyati—
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyā abhihāra pāda udakam pāda pīṭha pāda kathalika patta cīvara paṭiggahaṇa nahāne piṭṭhi parikammam sādiyati
translated: He doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a bed, a chair, water for washing his feet and a foot stool, a foot scraper, receiving his bowl and robe, or massaging his back when he’s bathing.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted.”

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattaṁ bhikkhuṁ sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, na ācāravipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, na diṭṭhivipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, na ājīvavipattiyā anuddhaṁseti, na bhikkhuṁ bhikkhūhi bhedeti—
analyzed: na pakatattam bhikkhum sīla vipattiyāḥ anuddhaseti na ācāra vipattiyāḥ anuddhaseti na diṭṭhi vipattiyāḥ anuddhaseti na ājīva vipattiyāḥ anuddhaseti na bhikkhum bhikkhūhi bhedeti
translated: he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in morality, he doesn’t charge him with failure in conduct, he doesn’t charge him with failure in view, he doesn’t charge him with failure in livelihood, he doesn’t cause division between monks.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Na gihiddhajaṁ dhāreti, na titthiyaddhajaṁ dhāreti, na titthiye sevati, bhikkhū sevati, bhikkhusikkhāya sikkhati—
analyzed: na gihiddhajam dhāreti na titthiya ddhajam dhāreti na titthiye sevati bhikkhū sevati bhikkhu sikkhāya sikkhati
translated: he doesn’t wear lay clothes, he doesn’t wear the robes of the monastics of other religions, he doesn’t associate with the monastics of other religions, he associates with monks, he trains in the monks’ training.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ ekacchanne āvāse vasati, na ekacchanne anāvāse vasati,
analyzed: na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhim eka channe āvāse vasati na eka channe anāvāse vasati
translated: he doesn’t stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t stay in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk;

original: na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati, pakatattaṁ bhikkhuṁ disvā āsanā vuṭṭhāti,
analyzed: na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati pakatattam bhikkhum disvā āsanā vuṭṭhāti
translated: he doesn’t stay in the same room, either in a monastery or in a non-monastery, as a regular monk; when he sees a regular monk, he gets up from his seat;

original: na pakatattaṁ bhikkhuṁ āsādeti anto vā bahi vā—
analyzed: na pakatattam bhikkhum āsādeti antar vā bahi vā
translated: he doesn’t invite a regular monk to stay in the same room, either inside or outside the monastery.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṁ karoti, na anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṁ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti na pavāraṇam ṭhapeti na savacanīyam karoti na anuvādam paṭṭhapeti na okāsam kāreti na codeti na sāreti na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: He doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk, doesn’t cancel his invitation ceremony, doesn’t direct him, doesn’t get him to do acts of obedience, doesn’t get him to acknowledge an offense, doesn’t charge him with an offense, doesn’t press him for a decision, and doesn’t get other monks to reconcile with him.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭha aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakamme paṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamme niṭṭhita
translated: The group of forty-three on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: And it should be lifted like this.

original: Tena, bhikkhave, channena bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: tena bhikkhave channena bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: The monk Channa should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ
analyzed: aha bhante saṅghena āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma kato sammā vattāmi loma
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not recognizing an offense. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably,

original: pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi, āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācāmī’ti.
analyzed: pātemi netthāram vattāmi āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācāmi iti
translated: I ask the Sangha for resolution of the legal procedure of ejecting me for not recognizing an offense.’

original: Dutiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: dutiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: A second time he should ask.

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: A third time he should ask.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati,
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kamma kato sammā vattati
translated: The monk Channa has had a legal procedure of ejection done against him for not recognizing an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably,

original: lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: lomam pāteti netthāram vattati āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: deserving to be released. He’s asking the Sangha to rescind the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambheyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should rescind the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against the monk Channa.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati,
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kamma kato sammā vattati
translated: The monk Channa has had a legal procedure of ejection done against him for not recognizing an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably,

original: lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: lomam pāteti netthāram vattati āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: he’s asking the Sangha for the lifting of the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense.

original: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against the monk Channa.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi so tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against the monk Channa should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati,🔽lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kamma kato sammā vattati  lomam pāteti netthāram vattati āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: The monk Channa, who’s been given the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense, is now conducting himself properly and suitably,🔽deserving to be released. He’s asking the Sangha for the lifting of the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense.

original: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against the monk Channa.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi so tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of rescinding the suspension transaction on monk Channa for not recognizing an offense should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Paṭippassaddhaṁ saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ.
analyzed: paṭippassaddham saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma
translated: The Sangha has rescinded the suspension transaction on monk Channa for not recognizing an offense.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.🔽Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti  āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kammam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”🔽The fifth section on the suspension transaction for not recognizing an offense is finished.

original: 6. Āpattiyāappaṭikammeukkhepanīyakamma
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kamma
translated: The suspension transaction for not making amends for an offense

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā kosambiyam viharati ghosita ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ paṭikātuṁ.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena āyasmā channaḥ āpattim āpajjitvā naḥ icchati āpattim paṭikātu
translated: On one occasion Venerable Channa had committed an offense, but he refused to recognize it.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

original: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṁ paṭikātun”ti?
analyzed: katham hi nāma āyasmā channaḥ āpattim āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattim paṭikātunti
translated: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to recognize it?”🔽…

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: The monks told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ paṭikātun”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā naḥ icchati āpattim paṭikātunti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Channa has committed an offense and refuses to make amends for it?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Buddha rebuked him,

original: “ananucchavikaṁ …pe…
analyzed: an anucchavikam pe
translated: “It’s not suitable, foolish man …

original: kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṁ paṭikātuṁ.
analyzed: katham hi nāma saḥ bhikkhave mogha purisaḥ āpattim āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattim paṭikātu
translated: How could that foolish man commit an offense and then refuse to make amends for it?

original: Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This won’t encourage confidence in those without it …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking him …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ karotu—
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam karotu
translated: ‘Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: He should not be in communion with the Sangha.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, kātabbaṁ—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave
translated: And, monks, it should be done like this.🔽The monk Channa should be told:

original: paṭhamaṁ channo bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṁ āropetabbo, āpattiṁ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: paṭhamam channaḥ bhikkhu codetabbaḥ codetvā sāretabbaḥ sāretvā āpattim āropetabbaḥ āpattim āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: First you should accuse the monk Channa, then remind him of it, then charge him with it. Once you’ve charged him with it, a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ paṭikātuṁ.
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā naḥ icchati āpattim paṭikātu
translated: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but he refuses to recognize it.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya—
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: He is not to take part in the Sangha’s business.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ paṭikātuṁ.
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā naḥ icchati āpattim paṭikātu
translated: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but he refuses to recognize it.

original: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense, prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: He is not to take part in the Sangha’s business.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense—

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: He’s not to have any interaction with the Sangha.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who approves of this should remain silent.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ channo bhikkhu āpattiṁ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṁ paṭikātuṁ.
analyzed: ayam channaḥ bhikkhu āpattim āpajjitvā naḥ icchati āpattim paṭikātu
translated: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but he refuses to recognize it.

original: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saṅghaḥ channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam karoti
translated: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense—

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: banishing him from the monastery.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṁ—
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇa
translated: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense—

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: banishing him from the monastery—

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: should remain silent.

original: Kataṁ saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ—
analyzed: katam saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kamma
translated: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense—

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: banishing him from the monastery.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’ti.🔽Āvāsaparamparañca, bhikkhave, saṁsatha—
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti 🔽āvāsa paramparam ca bhikkhave sasatha
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’🔽And you should pass on the monastery’s dwelling place to another.”

original: ‘channo bhikkhu saṅghena āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammakato—
analyzed: channaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ
translated: ‘The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense,

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghenā’ti.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena ati
translated: and he’s not to have any contact with the Sangha.’

original: 6.1. Adhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: adhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: 12 unlawful legal procedures

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Asammukhā kataṁ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: asammukhā katam hoti appaṭipucchā katam hoti appaṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has these three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of.

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: anāpattiyā katam hoti a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense. …🔽…

original: acodetvā kataṁ hoti, asāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽asammukhā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a codetvā katam hoti a sāretvā katam hoti āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti pe  asammukhā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done without accusing the person; it is done without reminding the person of their offense; it is done without charging the person with the offense. …🔽it is done not face-to-face; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: appaṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽appaṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽anāpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: appaṭipucchā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  appaṭiññāya katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  anāpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done without questioning the person; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done without the admission of the person; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done against one who is not an offense; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽desitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽acodetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe  a codetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done against one whose confession has not been received; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done against one whose confession has been received; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …🔽it is done without accusing the person; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: asāretvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a sāretvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it is done without reminding the person of their offense; it is done illegitimately; it is done by an incomplete assembly. …

original: āpattiṁ anāropetvā kataṁ hoti, adhammena kataṁ hoti, vaggena kataṁ hoti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
analyzed: āpattim an āropetvā katam hoti adhammena katam hoti vaggena katam hoti  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam adhamma kammam ca hoti avinaya kammam ca duvūpasantañca
translated: it is done without having accused the person of an offense; it is illegitimate; it is done by an incomplete assembly.🔽When a legal procedure of ejecting someone for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyakamme adhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kamme adhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The twelfth section on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

original: 6.2. Dhammakammadvādasaka
analyzed: dhamma kamma dvādasaka
translated: … Legitimate legal procedures

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantañca
translated: When a legal procedure of ejecting someone for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Sammukhā kataṁ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: sammukhā katam hoti paṭipucchā katam hoti paṭiññāya katam hoti
translated: it’s done in the presence of the accused; it’s done with questioning; it’s done with the admission of the accused.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantañca
translated: When a legal procedure of ejecting someone for not recognizing an offense has these three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of.🔽…

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantañca
translated: When a procedure of ejecting for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

original: Āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽codetvā kataṁ hoti, sāretvā kataṁ hoti, āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽sammukhā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: āpattiyā katam hoti desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti adesitāya āpattiyā katam hoti pe  codetvā katam hoti sāretvā katam hoti āpattim āropetvā katam hoti pe  sammukhā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense; it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession; it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense. …🔽it’s done after accusing; it’s done after reminding; it’s done after charging. …🔽it’s done in the presence of; it’s done legitimately; it’s done by a unanimous assembly. …

original: paṭipucchā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽paṭiññāya kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: paṭipucchā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  paṭiññāya katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done after questioning; it’s done legitimately; it’s done by a unanimous assembly. …🔽it’s done by admission; it’s done legitimately; it’s done by a unanimous assembly. …

original: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: desanā gāminiyā āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense; it’s done legitimately; it’s done by a unanimous assembly. …🔽it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession; it’s done legitimately; it’s done by a unanimous assembly. …

original: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽codetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…
analyzed: a desitāya āpattiyā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  codetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe
translated: “The offense hasn’t been admitted, but the procedure was done legitimately and in accordance with the rule. …🔽“The monk has been accused, but the procedure was done legitimately and in accordance with the rule. …

original: sāretvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti …pe…🔽āpattiṁ āropetvā kataṁ hoti, dhammena kataṁ hoti, samaggena kataṁ hoti—
analyzed: sāretvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti pe  āpattim āropetvā katam hoti dhammena katam hoti samaggena katam hoti
translated: “The monk has admitted to the offense, but the procedure was done legitimately and in accordance with the rule. …🔽“The offense has been laid aside, but the procedure was done legitimately and in accordance with the rule.”

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṁ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi aṅgehi samannāgate āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam dhamma kammañca hoti vinaya kammañca su vūpasantañca
translated: When a procedure of ejecting for not making amends for an offense has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

original: Āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyakamme dhammakammadvādasakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kamme dhamma kamma dvādasakam niṭṭhita
translated: The section on twelve kinds of legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.

original: 6.3. Ākaṅkhamānachakka
analyzed: ākaṅkhamāna chakka
translated: . The group of six on wishing

original: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
