analyzed: tiṇṇa bhikkhave bhikkhūna ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting a monk for not giving up a bad view if three monks accuse him.

original: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
analyzed: ekaḥ bhaṇḍana kārakaḥ hoti kalaha kārakaḥ vivāda kārakaḥ bhassa kārako saṅghe adhikaraṇa kārakaḥ
translated: One who is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

original: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
analyzed: ekaḥ bālaḥ hoti abyattaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ an apadānaḥ
translated: one who is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;

original: eko gihisaṁsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi—
analyzed: ekaḥ gihisasaṭṭhaḥ viharati ananulomikehi gihisasaggehi
translated: one who is socializing with householders in a way that is improper for monastics.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wishes, it may, in relation to these three kinds of monks, do a legal procedure of ejecting them for not giving up a bad view.

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may also, in relation to three other kinds of monks, do a procedure of ejecting them for not giving up a bad view.

original: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
analyzed: ekaḥ adhi sīle sīla vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ajjhācāre ācāra vipannaḥ hoti ekaḥ ati diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhi vipannaḥ hoti
translated: One who has failed in the higher morality; one who has failed in conduct; one who has failed in view.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: If the Sangha wishes, it may, in relation to these three kinds of monks, do a procedure of ejecting them for not giving up a bad view.”

original: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: aparesam pi bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting a monk for not giving up a bad view, even if he’s one of three.

original: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—
analyzed: ekaḥ buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati ekaḥ saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: One who disparages the Buddha, one who disparages the Teaching, and one who disparages the Sangha.

original: imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissage, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kareyya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave tiṇṇam bhikkhūnaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissage ukkhepanīya kammam kareyya
translated: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting a monk for not giving up a bad view, even if he’s one of these three.

original: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissage ukkhepanīyakamme ākaṅkhamānachakkaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissage ukkhepanīya kamme ākaṅkhamāna chakkam niṭṭhita
translated: The group of six on wishing in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

original: 7.4. Tecattālīsavatta
analyzed: tecattālīsavatta
translated: … thirty-seven kinds of conduct

original: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṁ.
analyzed: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma katena bhikkhave bhikkhunā sammā
translated: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view done against himself should conduct himself properly.

original: Tatrāyaṁ sammāvattanā—🔽na upasampādetabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatra ayam sammāvattanā  na upasampādetabba
translated: This is the proper conduct:🔽he shouldn’t give the full ordination,

original: na nissayo dātabbo,🔽na sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo,
analyzed: na nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ  na sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: he shouldn’t give formal support,🔽he shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him,

original: na bhikkhunovādakasammuti sāditabbā,
analyzed: na bhikkhunā uvādaka sammuti sāditabbā
translated: he shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns,

original: sammatenapi bhikkhuniyo na ovaditabbā.
analyzed: sammatena api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovaditabbā
translated: And you should not instruct the nuns, even if you are asked.🔽You should not commit the same offense for which the Sangha did this procedure of ejecting you for not giving up a bad view.

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,🔽aññā vā tādisikā,
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam katam hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā  aññā vā tādisikā
translated: You should not commit an offense similar to it.

original: tato vā pāpiṭṭhatarā;🔽kammaṁ na garahitabbaṁ,
analyzed: tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatarā  kammam na
translated: You should not commit an offense worse than it.🔽You should not criticize the procedure.🔽You should not criticize those who did the procedure. …🔽You should not cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

original: kammikā na garahitabbā …pe…,
analyzed: kammikā na garahitabbā pe
translated: You should not cancel the invitation ceremony of a trainee nun.🔽You should not give the full admission to a trainee nun.🔽You should not give formal support to a trainee nun.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a novice nun.🔽You should not give formal support to a novice nun.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a novice monk.

original: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatho ṭhapetabbo,🔽na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā,
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaḥ ṭhapetabbaḥ  na pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā
translated: You should not give formal support to a novice monk.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a novice nun.🔽You should not give formal support to a novice nun.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a male lay follower.🔽You should not give formal support to a male lay follower.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a female lay follower.

original: na savacanīyaṁ kātabbaṁ,🔽na anuvādo paṭṭhapetabbo,
analyzed: na savacanīyam  na anuvādaḥ paṭṭhapetabbo
translated: You should not give formal support to a female lay follower.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a male or female householder.

original: na okāso kāretabbo,🔽na codetabbo,
analyzed: na okāsaḥ kāretabbo  na codetabbaḥ
translated: You should not give formal support to a male or female householder.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a paṇḍaka.🔽You should not give formal support to a paṇḍaka.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a hermaphrodite.

original: na sāretabbo,
analyzed: na sāretabbaḥ
translated: You should not give formal support to a hermaphrodite.

original: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabban”ti.🔽Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme tecattālīsavattaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti  pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamme tecattālīsa vattam niṭṭhita
translated: You should not give the full ordination to a monk who’s committed the worst kind of offense.🔽You should not give formal support to a monk who’s committed the worst kind of offense.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a monk who’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense.🔽You should not give formal support to a monk who’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense.🔽You should not give the full ordination to a monk who’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense.🔽You should not give formal support to a monk who’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense.

original: Atha kho saṅgho ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ akāsi—
analyzed: atha kho saṅghaḥ ariṭṭhassa bhikkhunaḥ gaddha bādhi pubbassa pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam akāsi
translated: You should not give the full ordination to a monk who’s been ejected for not giving up a bad view.

original: asambhogaṁ saṅghena.
analyzed: a sambhogam saṅghena
translated: You should not give formal support to

original: So saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhami.
analyzed: saḥ saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ vibbhami
translated: He then disrobed.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

original: “kathañhi nāma ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhamissatī”ti?
analyzed: katham hi nāma ariṭṭhaḥ bhikkhu gaddha bādhipubbaḥ saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ vibbhamissati iti
translated: “How could Ariṭṭha disrobe after the Sangha had done a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhamatī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave ariṭṭhaḥ bhikkhu gaddha bādhipubbaḥ saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ vibbhamati iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Ariṭṭha disrobed after the Sangha had done a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Buddha rebuked him,

original: “ananucchavikaṁ …pe…
analyzed: an anucchavikam pe
translated: “It’s not suitable …

original: kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhamissati?
analyzed: katham hi nāma saḥ bhikkhave mogha purisaḥ saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ vibbhamissati
translated: How could that foolish person disrobe after the Sangha had done a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view?

original: Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking him …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetu.🔽7.5. Nappaṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsaka
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetu  na ppaṭippassambhetabba te cattālīsaka
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should lift that legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view.🔽The group of forty-three on not to be lifted

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Upasampādeti, nissayaṁ deti, sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
analyzed: upasampādeti nissayam deti sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadati
translated: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissage, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissage ukkhepanīya kammam  aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;

original: kammaṁ garahati, kammike garahati—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ …
analyzed: kammam garahati kammike garahati  imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabbam
translated: he disparages the procedure; he disparages those who did the procedure.🔽When a monk has these five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view shouldn’t be lifted. …

original: pe….
analyzed: pe
translated: … he disparages the Monastic Law; he disparages those who uphold the Monastic Law. …🔽… he disparages the training; he disparages those who practice the training. …🔽… he disparages the Pāṭimokkha; he disparages those who recite the Pāṭimokkha. …🔽… he disparages the observance day; he disparages those who observe the observance day. …

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṁ karoti, anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṁ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam  pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti pavāraṇam ṭhapeti savacanīyam karoti anuvādam paṭṭhapeti okāsam kāreti codeti sāreti bhikkhūhi sampayojeti  imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭha aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam na paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view shouldn’t be lifted:

original: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme nappaṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽7.6. Paṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsaka🔽Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamme na paṭippassambhetabba tecattālīsakam niṭṭhita 🔽      🔽pañcahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: he gives a full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he has a trainee nun attend on him; he has a pupil attend on him; he receives robe-cloth from a trainee nun; he receives almsfood from a trainee nun; he receives fresh or cooked food from a trainee nun; he receives food from her by himself after motioning with his hand or after going to her or after making an appointment; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun; he receives a meal invitation from a group of trainee nuns; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun and a group of trainee nuns; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun and a family; he receives a meal invitation from a group of trainee nuns and a family; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun, a group of trainee nuns, and a family; he receives a meal invitation for the following day from a trainee nun; he receives a meal invitation for the following day from a group of trainee nuns; he receives a meal invitation for the following day from a trainee nun and a group of trainee nuns; he receives a meal invitation for the following day from a trainee nun and a family; he receives a meal invitation for the following day from a group of trainee nuns and a family; he receives a meal invitation for the following day from a trainee nun, a group of trainee nuns, and a family; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun by himself after motioning with his hand or after going to her or after making an appointment; he receives a meal invitation from a group of trainee nuns by himself after motioning with his hand or after going to them or after making an appointment; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun and a group of trainee nuns by himself after motioning with his hand or after going to them or after making an appointment; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun and a family by himself after motioning with his hand or after going to them or after making an appointment; he receives a meal invitation from a group of trainee nuns and a family by himself after motioning with his hand or after going to them or after making an appointment; he receives a meal invitation from a trainee nun, a group of trainee nuns, and a family by himself after motioning with his hand or after going to them or after making an appointment; he gives the full

original: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṁ deti, na sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṁ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
analyzed: na upasampādeti na nissayam deti na sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhāpeti na bhikkhunovādaka sammutim sādiyati sammataḥ api bhikkhuniyaḥ na ovadati
translated: He doesn’t give the full ordination, doesn’t give formal support, doesn’t accept a novice monk to wait on him, doesn’t accept a trainee nun as his attendant, and doesn’t consent to being advised by a regular nun. Even if he consents, he doesn’t advise the nuns.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted:

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave pañca aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted:

original: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ kataṁ hoti taṁ āpattiṁ na āpajjati, aññaṁ vā tādisikaṁ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṁ;
analyzed: yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam katam hoti tam āpattim na āpajjati aññam vā tādisika tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatara
translated: He doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view, nor one similar to it, nor one worse than it;

original: kammaṁ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
analyzed: kammam na garahati kammike na garahati
translated: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure;

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ …🔽pe….
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabbam  pe
translated: When a monk has five other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted:

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: … When a monk has eight other qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted:

original: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṁ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṁ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṁ karoti, na anuvādaṁ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṁ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
analyzed: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposatham ṭhapeti na pavāraṇam ṭhapeti na savacanīyam karoti na anuvādam paṭṭhapeti na okāsam kāreti na codeti na sāreti na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti
translated: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t do legal acts toward a regular monk; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t submit to a regular monk; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave aṭṭha haṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambhetabba
translated: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted.”

original: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme paṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamme niṭṭhita
translated: The group of forty-three on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, paṭippassambhetabbaṁ.🔽Tena, bhikkhave, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakatena bhikkhunā🔽saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave  tena bhikkhave pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma katena bhikkhunā  saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā
translated: And it should be lifted like this.

original: ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: The monk who’s had the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view done against him should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

original: ‘ahaṁ, bhante, saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā
analyzed: aha bhante saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kato sammā
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejection against me for not giving up a bad view,

original: vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa
analyzed: vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīyassa
translated: but I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released.

original: kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

original: Tatiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: tatiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ
translated: This monk so-and-so has had a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view done against him by the Sangha,🔽but he’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released.

original: sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge,🔽ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge  ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: He’s conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released.🔽He’s asking for the lifting of the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambheyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift that procedure.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ
translated: The monk so-and-so has been given the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view.

original: sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge,🔽ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge  ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: He’s conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released.🔽He’s asking for the lifting of the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha lifts that procedure.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of rescinding the suspension transaction on monk so-and-so for not relinquishing an evil view should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.

original: Dutiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi etam attham vadāmi pe
translated: For the second time I speak on this matter. …

original: tatiyampi etamatthaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: tatiyam pi etam attham vadāmi
translated: For the third time I speak on this matter. …

original: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato🔽sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma kataḥ  sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā a paṭinissagge
translated: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of suspension against monk so-and-so for not relinquishing an evil view.

original: ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṁ yācati.
analyzed: ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhim yācati
translated: He is now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He is asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambheti.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam paṭippassambheti
translated: The Sangha rescinds the legal procedure of suspension against him for not relinquishing an evil view.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of rescinding the suspension transaction on the monk so-and-so for not relinquishing an evil view should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.

original: Paṭippassaddhaṁ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṁ.
analyzed: paṭippassaddham saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kamma
translated: The Saṅgha has rescinded the suspension transaction on the monk so-and-so for not relinquishing an evil view.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Saṅgha has approved, so it remains rescinded.”

original: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakammaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.🔽Kammakkhandhako paṭhamo. Imamhi khandhake vatthū satta.
analyzed: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīya kammam niṭṭhitam sattama  kamma khandhako paṭhamaḥ imamhi khandhake vatthū satta
translated: The legal procedure of suspension for not relinquishing an evil view is finished.

original: Tassuddānaṁ🔽Paṇḍulohitakā bhikkhū,
analyzed: tassa uddāna  paṇḍulohitakāḥ bhikkhū
translated: The first chapter on legal procedures is finished. In this chapter there are seven topics.🔽The summary:🔽The monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka,

original: sayaṁ bhaṇḍanakārakā;
analyzed: sayam bhaṇḍana kārakā
translated: themselves the makers of quarrels;

original: Tādise upasaṅkamma,
analyzed: tādise upasaṅkamma
translated: approaching such a one,

original: ussahiṁsu ca bhaṇḍane.🔽Anuppannāpi jāyanti,
analyzed: ussahisu ca bhaṇḍane  an uppannāḥ api jāyanti
translated: they instigated a quarrel.🔽They were born, though not yet arisen,

original: uppannānipi vaḍḍhare;
analyzed: uppannāni api vaḍḍhare
translated: and the arisen ones increased;

original: Appicchā pesalā bhikkhū,
analyzed: appicchāḥ pesalāḥ bhikkhū
translated: the modest monks with few desires

original: ujjhāyanti padassato.
analyzed: ujjhāyanti padassataḥ

original: Saddhammaṭṭhitiko buddho,
analyzed: saddhamma ṭṭhitikaḥ buddhaḥ
translated: The Buddha, the one who upholds the true Teaching,

original: sayambhū aggapuggalo;
analyzed: sayambhū agga puggalaḥ
translated: the self-awakened one, the foremost person,

original: Āṇāpesi tajjanīya,
analyzed: tajjanīya
translated: The Victor ordered a censure,

original: kammaṁ sāvatthiyaṁ jino.
analyzed: kammam sāvatthiyam jino
translated: a transaction in Sāvatthī.

original: Asammukhāppaṭipucchāp-
analyzed: a sammukha ap paṭipuccha ap
translated: Not face-to-face, not having questioned,

original: paṭiññāya katañca yaṁ;
analyzed: paṭiññāya katañca ya
translated: and that which was done by admission;

original: Anāpatti adesane,
analyzed: anāpatti a desane
translated: Not an offence, not confessed,

analyzed: desitāya katañca ya  a codetvā a sāretvā  ca yam
translated: and that which was done by one who has confessed.🔽Not having accused, not having reminded,🔽and that which was done without having charged;

original: Asammukhā adhammena,🔽vaggena cāpi yaṁ kataṁ.
analyzed: asammukhāḥ adhammena  vaggena ca api yam
translated: Not face-to-face, illegitimately,🔽and that which was done by an incomplete (assembly);

original: Appaṭipucchā adhammena,
analyzed: appaṭipucchā adhammena
translated: Not having questioned, illegitimately,

original: puna vaggena yaṁ kataṁ;
analyzed: puna vaggena yam kata
translated: and again that which was done by an incomplete (assembly);

original: Appaṭiññāya adhammena,🔽vaggena cāpi yaṁ kataṁ.
analyzed: appaṭiññāya adhammena  vaggena ca api yam
translated: Not by admission, illegitimately,🔽and that which was done by an incomplete (assembly);

original: Anāpatti adhammena,🔽vaggena cāpi yaṁ kataṁ;
analyzed: anāpatti adhammena  vaggena ca api yam
translated: Not an offence, illegitimately,🔽and that which was done by an incomplete (assembly);

original: Adesanāgāminiyā,
analyzed: a desanā gāminiyā
translated: Not one deserving to be admonished,

original: adhammavaggameva ca.
analyzed: adhamma vaggam eva ca
translated: and illegitimately, by an incomplete (assembly).

original: Desitāya adhammena,
analyzed: desitāya adhammena
translated: Confessed, illegitimately,

original: vaggenāpi tatheva ca;
analyzed: vaggena api tathā iva ca
translated: and likewise by an incomplete (assembly);

original: Acodetvā adhammena,
analyzed: a codetvā adhammena
translated: Not having accused, illegitimately,

original: vaggenāpi tatheva ca.
analyzed: vaggena api tathā iva ca
translated: and likewise by an incomplete (assembly);

original: Asāretvā adhammena,
analyzed: a sāretvā adhammena
translated: Not having reminded, illegitimately,

original: vaggenāpi tatheva ca;
analyzed: vaggena api tathā iva ca
translated: and likewise by an incomplete (assembly);

original: Anāropetvā adhammena,
analyzed: an āropetvā adhammena
translated: Not having charged, illegitimately,

original: vaggenāpi tatheva ca.
analyzed: vaggena api tathā iva ca
translated: and likewise by an incomplete (assembly).

original: Kaṇhavāranayeneva,
analyzed: kaṇha vāra nayena iva
translated: Just as in the case of the dark section,

original: sukkavāraṁ vijāniyā;
analyzed: sukkavāram
translated: one should understand the bright section;

original: Saṅgho ākaṅkhamāno ca,
analyzed: saṅghaḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ ca
translated: The Saṅgha, if it wishes,

original: yassa tajjanīyaṁ kare.🔽Bhaṇḍanaṁ bālo saṁsaṭṭho,🔽adhisīle ajjhācāre;
analyzed: yaḥ sa tajjanīyam kare 🔽bhaṇḍanam bālo sa saṭṭhaḥ 🔽adhi sīle ajjhācāre
translated: for one who should be censured.

original: Atidiṭṭhivipannassa,
analyzed: ati diṭṭhi vipannassa
translated: For one who is very much confused about views,

original: saṅgho tajjanīyaṁ kare.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ tajjanīyam kare
translated: the Sangha should do a condemnation procedure.

original: Buddhadhammassa saṅghassa,🔽avaṇṇaṁ yo ca bhāsati;
analyzed: buddha dhammassa saṅghassa  avaṇṇam yaḥ ca bhāsati
translated: For one who disparages the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha,

original: Tiṇṇannampi ca bhikkhūnaṁ,
analyzed: tiṇṇannam pi ca bhikkhūna
translated: and for one who disparages any of the three kinds of monks,

original: saṅgho tajjaniyaṁ kare.🔽Bhaṇḍanaṁ kārako eko,🔽bālo saṁsagganissito;
analyzed: kare  bhaṇḍanam  bālaḥ sa sagga nissitaḥ
translated: the Sangha should do a condemnation procedure.🔽One who is quarrelsome, ignorant, and dependent on others,

original: Adhisīle ajjhācāre,
analyzed: adhi sīle ajjhācāre
translated: in regard to the higher morality, the higher conduct,

original: tatheva atidiṭṭhiyā.🔽Buddhadhammassa saṅghassa,🔽avaṇṇaṁ yo ca bhāsati;
analyzed: tathā iva atidiṭṭhiyā  buddha dhammassa saṅghassa  avaṇṇam yaḥ ca bhāsati
translated: and the higher views,🔽For one who disparages the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha,

original: Tajjanīyakammakato,
analyzed: tajjanīya kamma kataḥ
translated: and for one who disparages any of the three kinds of monks,

original: evaṁ sammānuvattanā.🔽Upasampadanissayā,🔽sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhanā;🔽Ovādasammatenāpi,
analyzed: evam sammā anuvattanā  upasampad anissayā  sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhanā  ovāda sammatena api
translated: the Sangha should do a condemnation procedure.🔽One who has been given this procedure should behave properly.

original: na kare tajjanīkato.
analyzed: na kare tad janīkataḥ
translated: He should not give the full ordination, give formal support,🔽or look after a novice monk.

original: Nāpajje tañca āpattiṁ,🔽tādisañca tato paraṁ;🔽Kammañca kammike cāpi,
analyzed: na āpajje tat ca āpatti  tādisañca tatas para  kamman ca kammike ca api
translated: He should not consent to advise the nuns,

original: na garahe tathāvidho.🔽Uposathaṁ pavāraṇaṁ,🔽pakatattassa naṭṭhape;
analyzed: na garahe tathāvidhaḥ  uposatham pavāraṇa  paka tattassa na ṭṭhape
translated: and he should not commit the same offense.

original: Savacaniṁ anuvādo,
analyzed: savacanim anuvādaḥ
translated: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense he was reproved for,

original: okāso codanena ca.🔽Sāraṇaṁ sampayogañca,🔽na kareyya tathāvidho;
analyzed: okāsaḥ codanena ca  sāraṇam sampayogam ca  na kareyya tathāvidhaḥ
translated: nor one that is worse.

original: Upasampadanissayā,
analyzed: upasampad anissayā
translated: He should not criticize the procedure or the person who did the procedure.🔽He should not cancel the observance-day ceremony or the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.🔽He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him, nor should he remind him of an offense.

original: sāmaṇeraṁ upaṭṭhanā.
analyzed: sāmaṇeram upaṭṭhanā
translated: He should not associate inappropriately with other monks.

original: Ovādasammatenāpi,
analyzed: ovāda sammatena api
translated: He should not give the full ordination, give formal support,🔽or look after a novice monk.

original: pañcahaṅgehi na sammati;
analyzed: pañca haṅgehi na sammati
translated: With five factors, he’s not fit:

original: Tañcāpajjati āpattiṁ,
analyzed: tat ca āpajjati āpatti
translated: He commits the offense,

original: tādisañca tato paraṁ.
analyzed: tādisañca tatas para
translated: And then he does the same again.🔽He criticizes the legal procedure,

original: Kammañca kammike cāpi,🔽garahanto na sammati;
analyzed: kamman ca kammike ca api  gara hantaḥ na sammati
translated: The one who did the procedure,

original: Uposathaṁ pavāraṇaṁ,
analyzed: uposatham pavāraṇa
translated: The observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony,

original: savacanīyā ca novādo.
analyzed: savacanīyā ca na u vādaḥ
translated: The directions, and the reminder.

original: Okāso codanañceva,
analyzed: okāsaḥ codanañca iva
translated: The asking for permission, the accusation,

original: sāraṇā sampayojanā;
analyzed: sāraṇā sampayojanā
translated: The reconciliation, and the urging:

original: Imehaṭṭhaṅgehi yo yutto,
analyzed: imehi aṭṭhaṅgehi yaḥ yuttaḥ
translated: One who has these eight factors

original: tajjanānupasammati.
analyzed: tad jana an upasammati
translated: Is not fit for the act of information.

original: Kaṇhavāranayeneva,
analyzed: kaṇha vāra nayena iva
translated: Just as with the dark section,

original: sukkavāraṁ vijāniyā;
analyzed: sukkavāram
translated: You should understand the bright section:

original: Bālo āpattibahulo,
analyzed: bālaḥ āpatti bahulaḥ
translated: The ignorant one, the one with many offenses,

original: saṁsaṭṭhopi ca seyyaso.
analyzed: sa saṭṭhaḥ pi ca seyyasaḥ
translated: And the one who associates with the laity.

original: Niyassakammaṁ sambuddho,🔽āṇāpesi mahāmuni;
analyzed: niyassa kammam sambuddhaḥ  mahā muni
translated: The Buddha, the Great Sage,🔽Ordered the procedure of demotion

original: Kīṭāgirismiṁ dve bhikkhū,
analyzed: kīṭāgirismim dve bhikkhū
translated: In Kīṭāgiri, for the two monks

original: assajipunabbasukā.🔽Anācārañca vividhaṁ,
analyzed: assa jipu nabbasukā  anācārañca
translated: Assaji and Punabbasuka.🔽They were not properly trained,

original: ācariṁsu asaññatā;
analyzed: ācarisu asañña tā
translated: And they misbehaved in many ways.

original: Pabbājanīyaṁ sambuddho,🔽kammaṁ sāvatthiyaṁ jino;
analyzed: pabbājanīyam sambuddhaḥ  kammam sāvatthiyam jino
translated: The Buddha, the Victor,🔽Ordered the procedure of banishment

original: Macchikāsaṇḍe sudhammo,
analyzed: macchikā saṇḍe sudhammo
translated: In Sāvatthī, for Sudhamma,

original: cittassāvāsiko ahu.
analyzed: ahu
translated: Who was the resident monk of Cittā.

original: Jātivādena khuṁseti,
analyzed: jāti vādena khusa iti
translated: He abused the lay follower Cittas,🔽Using the expression “You’re a woman,”

original: sudhammo cittupāsakaṁ;
analyzed: sudhammaḥ cittupāsaka
translated: The Buddha, the Perfected One,🔽Ordered the procedure of reconciliation.

original: Paṭisāraṇīyakammaṁ,
analyzed: paṭisāraṇīya kamma
translated: In Kosambī, the monk Channa

analyzed: tathāgataḥ 🔽kosambiyam channam bhikkhu 🔽nicchanta āpattim passitu

translated: To eject him for not seeing,

analyzed: āṇāpesi jinuttamaḥ
